title: Visit to Italy
review: We've never been to Italy before so this was a 1st for all of ower group, and I have to say it was amazing,we stayed at the Hotel Europa at Rva Del Garda right on the lake front. The hotel was superb we had an amazing time the food was very good although they could have had a change from scrambled or boiled eggs at breakfast but other than that we found no faults with quality, the rooms where comfortable although the single rooms I believe where a bit cramped not enough space for everything.     The resort itself was great plenty of bars and restaurants ,if you didn't have half board, not  cheap but then again we were told that Italy was expensive. We did a boat trip round the lake and stopped off at different towns, travelled to Venice well worth a trip it's a beautiful city and we did a gondola ride which is a must. Visited  Verona for the day,again it has a lot of history,saw juliet's statue and the balcony,and travelled up to the Dolomite what an amazing day that was.  All in all our holiday was amazing I don't think anyone could say anything negative about it. The best thing about the trip was the company we booked with all the trips where included in the price except the gondola which was extra but still worth doing it cost €20 per person which was booked by our guide who travelled with us daily on all the trips …

title: Wine, food and lovely surrounds.
review: We stayed here over the festive season including seeing the new year in & the old one out. I cant praise this hotel enough, the food was out of this world, and as for the friendly  staff they all went far and beyond what was expected, sterling job & absolutely first class.  Only had one issue, room 222 was a bit on the small size. Considering, its mainly only for sleeping we found this was exceptable. My humble gratitude to all the staff and wish them a happy new year.

title: Excellent staff
review: Dear FMBFeering, we would like to thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We're elated to read your kind words about the staff and the food, you made our day! We are looking forward to welcome you again soon (in a larger room, of course).  Best regards,    The Management

title: Hotel Europa
review: This hotel is perfectly placed for exploring the north of the lake. Food was excellent and the staff went out of their way to cater for our needs (vegetarian). All other staff were were friendly and helpful.

title: Great location
review: Great location on the harbour front of Riva Del Garda, next to coffee shops, bars and restaurants, although central the hotel itself was not noisy.  We visited as part of a Riviera Travel Group and found the rooms to be clean and spacious.  Evening meals are chosen each day at breakfast time, as a vegetarian I was well catered for as the head waiter offered me an alternative to the meat dishes served each evening.Would recommend this hotel.

title: Best Hotel in Riva Del Garda
review: Hotel is located right in the center - beautiful rooms, elegant breakfast room with excellent assortment (scrambled eggs, tomatoes, good coffee, fresh squeezed juice) - with a beautiful view of the lakefront.     The location is a short stroll to many great cafe's and restaurants. We were fortunate to hear a live band play all evening - Pink Floyd echoing into the surrounding mountains.  This hotel and piazza cannot be beat.  Lots of little side streets with great shopping.  Hotel service is excellent, this is the best hotel in Riva Del Garda.    Walking is easy here, many side streets.

title: Hotel Europa... Skypool?
review: This hotel is in a great location, Riva del Garda is a beautiful town to stay in with many restaurants to choose from and beautiful views. We paid for a room with a lake view, and the view really was spectacular and worth paying for. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast room has wonderful views and there was a good spread of different foods.  However, when my fiancé and I looked for hotels, we specifically looked for ones with a swimming pool. The management photos of the pool are taken from clever angles which suggests the pool is a lot larger than it actually is and also suggests there is a cocktail bar up there. The pool is really tiny and very cold, and drinks are not served or allowed up there. This was a huge disappointment. We still really liked the rest of…

title: Fantastic stay
review: We simply Love This hotel  Everything Was Perfect  We had a familyroom with 2 bathrooms  Located on 4 th floor Very Clean, very polite staff All The time  We stayed for 10 days Loved The posibility to take the bikes To The Beach  Breakfast Was Outstanding 🤩

title: Excellent
review: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of service, food and rooms, as we were on a budget holiday we could have perhaps expected less. The hotel is well situated overlooking the lake with the spectacular  mountains . We arrived very late at night due to an accident on the road but the staff couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant, even offering food had we required it

title: A perfectly located traditional hotel on the quayside at Riva.
review: This is the only hotel that I haved stayed at on three occasions, the latest just three weeks ago. Its is superbly positioned and surrounded by restaurants and bars. Thr staff are very welcoming and the food is just superb. A room overlooking Lake Garda is a must. Highly recommended.

title: Disappointed this time around.
review: Have been to this hotel 3x before but was told under new management.  The location is great and the breakfast is still excellent but this time had a problem with a/c and service was poor.  After arriving went down to the front desk twice to complain and was told that on their computer the temp was ok and then it would now be okay. After sweating through the night I went down to request a room change.  Guici told me computer showed temp ok and then sent a young man behind desk ato go up to room with me.  Upon arriving he said You can't stay in this room to which Guicy, apparently in charge said she would send technicians to room.  After returning 5::00 and told the problem should be fixed, it was not and the techs had not been sent because when they finally came they immediately…

title: Viva Riva
review: Travelled with Riviera Travel in June. We had booked a lake view room , so worth it for the amazing  views. The bathroom was very large and modern. The bedroom was small but adequate, no need for anything bigger. The aircon was superb, especially coming in from the gruelling heat outside. We had no fault to find with this hotel whatsoever.  The staff were extremely pleasant and so, so friendly. Well done for your efficiency and making meal times a truly enjoyable experience. Some dishes were not to our liking, but that was purely down to our own wrong choice and not the quality. So no negativity there. Location of hotel is excellent,  and sitting out in the  little bars outside people watching, and listening to the entertainment was so relaxing. The trips organised by Riviera,…

title: Refreshing experience
review: Great location, central and very convenient.  Refreshing to find a holiday hotel with friendly  and helpful staff, a restaurant that is adequate to cater for numerous clients with a very good selection of food, and waitering staff who appeared pleased and happy to serve you.   Room was small, but adequate.  Not surprising, as it was a converted old original building.

title: Boy, did we get lucky
review: We had to drive from South France to the Munich airport to fly back home.  We decided to stop 1/2 way in Riva Del Garda.  Fairly randomly chosen city (about half way), fairly randomly chosen place to stay (Hotel Europa). Boy, did we get lucky. I loved this place, my wife adored this place.  I'm sure the serendipity helped the mood, but this hotel was very nice. The location is ideal.  Right on the end of the lake right next to the Ferry dock.  We were driving, which can be painful in Europe.  However, there is a single parking area, not spot, but area to unload luggage right in front of the entrance.  Once inside, they direct you to their reserved parking spots in the garage 2 blocks away.  Plenty of room to park which was pleasing. Our room had a balcony looking perfectly out…

title: Really Rather Good
review: I’m not going to say “rather good considering the price” as that implies “you only get what you pay for”. It wouldn’t do justice to the quality of this hotel. It really is pretty good. It’s very close to the ferry stop and very close to a huge selection of shops and restaurants in the old town. It has all the facilities you need and the rooms have safes, and are air-conditioned etc. The staff are very helpful, giving guidance on a wide range of topics. The buffet breakfast is extensive and of good quality. The only downside is that, on a limited number of evenings, a band plays in the square outside some of the rooms; this may or may not bother you, and it is certainly not an issue that the hotel can do anything about. So all-in-all, it was really good.

title: Paying for the location
review: There's nothing particularly *wrong* with this hotel, but you're essentially paying for a top-knotch location, nothing more. It's not a four-star hotel -- more like a good three-star hotel -- and despite some of the management's comments below, I've stayed in so many hotels around the world that I have a fine-tuned sense of what a four-star hotel is like.   On the positive side, the staff is mostly friendly, and there is a real treat at breakfast: freshly-squeezed juice of practically any kind you can imagine. On the downside:  - Parking is a nightmare. Theoretically the hotel offers paid parking at a nearby garage about three city blocks away. In practice, the garage entrance (not the garage itself) is hard to find and lacks signage, and although the hotel gives you an access…

title: Lovely week in Riva
review: Enjoyed a lovely week in Riva at the Europa!  Lovely to be right in the centre of things! Noisy but we enjoyed the buzz!  Staff friendly and helpful, & food good - enjoyed our stay!  Pity there’s a supplement for a basic single room overlooking the building work but the double with a balcony overlooking the lake was lovely & the double glazing effective! - as was the air conditioning!

title: Wonderful 4* hotel by the lake
review: Booked this hotel after seeing so many good reviews. A truly well deserved 4* hotel. Spacious rooms, excellent buffet breakfast with the lovely Paolo keeping everything running smoothly. A spacious lounge with lots of info of places to visit. All the staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, thank you to Andrea for his tips on where to eat and booking us the day trip to Milan via europlan (brochures by reception). The hotel is directly opposite the ferry for the to the towns around Garda. Limone is a must.  If you fly into Verona as we did the best way to keep the cost down is as follows. Aerobus from Verona airport to Verona Porta Nuova €6pp. Train from Verona Porta Nuova (opposite) to Rovereto €5.90pp this takes approx 1hr. Tip if you buy tickets directly at the…

title: Hmmmm
review: Dear Expedition809669, your enthusiastic review made our day, thank you! We're glad to read that you liked so much the hotel and how helpful our staff is, we always try our best to make our guests happy. All the hotel staff wishes you a fantastic summer and we really hope to see you again here at Hotel Europa. Kind regards,

title: Great location
review: Just back from a weeks stay at the Europa. The hotel promotes itself as four star but in my humble opinion it is three star at best. The staff were great,the hotel itself was ok but the food served at diner was appalling.So bad in fact that we ate out after sampling the first two nights offerings.Shame really as the location is spot on. Many around us felt the same but I don’t know if they will share on TA. The buffet breakfast was good with plenty of choice and variety,the bar prices were very reasonable but,oh dear,the food at diner was truly awful. If you are considering a stay in Riva then the Hotel Europa is a good spot BUT have diner in the town where one can eat really well.

title: 4* Hotel
review: Situated on Lake Garda. Evening meals were amazing, such choice & no meal was offered more than once. A 9 course dinner on New Year’s Eve, with fireworks on the lake with the  Dining room overlooking the lake. Evening meals were served, to the table, whilst breakfast was buffet style. Afternoon tea & cake offered every afternoon. Room 212 was very large, like a junior suite, although this had restricted view of the lake. Enjoyed watching the locals have their New Years dip in the lake.

title: Amazing Christmas stay
review: We visited here for a 5 day Christmas break, travelling with Newmarket holidays. We had an amazing time staying here half Board. The food and menu choices were top notch, the staff were also very good ensuring we had everything we needed. We had a room facing the beautiful lake. We didn’t notice any noise, and it was lovely to throw open the Curtains and see beautiful Lake Garda. We will definite return one day.

title: Riviera package at the Europa
review: Stayed here as part of a Riviera package holiday. Beautiful hotel right on the shore of Lake Garda, right next to the main town square, close to the restaurants. We stayed here in July and were fortunate to see a music dancing festival parading in the square and sometimes along the hotel front. The room itself was ok, no view, but we didn’t pay extra for one. Room service was daily to a high standard.  The food was always first class with plenty of choice. Some people said there was too much pasta, really!  in Italy what do you expect! Breakfast was buffet, and the evening was buffet starters, salad & deserts, with the mains being ordered at breakfast from a choice of five. To be honest I could have lived on just the buffet, always something different every day and plenty of it.…

title: Wonderful stay
review: Dear George,  thank you so much for taking the time to write such an in-depth review, this kind of feedback is vital for us. We're glad to hear that you had a good time during your stay and enjoyed the food, your kind words made our chef blush! On the other hand, it's unfortunate that you never had the chance to dine on the terrace, we owe you an apology.  Usually, you are allocated a new table at each meal by the headwaiter, it seems that something went wrong. We hope to see you again soon, this time we'll make sure to reserve you a table on the terrace!  The Management

title: The best hotel in Riva
review: We booked the Europa with Riviera Travel. The hotel is located on the shores of Lake Garda. The setting is beautiful. There are plenty of bars and restaurants and plenty to see and do.  the hotel is easy to find. The check in was great and the room was well laid out and always clean and presentable. All of the food that we had was top class served by helpful, friendly and polite staff.  Its quite something to have your breakfast looking out over the lake.  Upstairs there is a sun terrace, small pool and Turkish bath.  My only gripe was that the WiFi though free, was unreliable.  All in all a great stay.

title: Riviera travel holiday
review: We had a fantastic week with Riviera travel, staying in a lake view room. The hotel could not be in a better position overlooking the lake and  paddle steamer that is docked right in front of the hotel. The food was very good indeed along with the efficient and friendly service from the restaurant team.  I loved that you could drink wines from the wine list that were produced within just a few miles from Riva.  A special thanks to Kate, our guide who was just the best!

title: Overpriced and poor value
review: Dear Badgerman,   thank you for giving us such a positive review! We're delighted to read that your vacation went so well, we hope to see you again soon!  The Management

title: A very comfortable hotel with friendly staff
review: The location is terrific and our view over the waterfront was lovely, however this didn't really compensate for the price paid. The staff are efficient but not very friendly. Our room was quite small and the air conditioning was very noisy. After travelling for 5 weeks in Switzerland and Italy I realized this hotel was very poor value for money.

title: A great and central placed hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week and were very pleased we chose it. Our room was comfortable and clean as well as being quiet which we heard was not the case for everyone. The hotel is situated on the edge of Lake Garda and we had a lovely view from the dining room. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the food was of a very high standard with a wide range of choices and plenty to eat. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Riva.

title: So pleased we chose this hotel!
review: I Stayed in a double room with my cousin i july. We choose lake view. The room had a view over the town square and the lake. If you don`t like noice i would not choose this. We heard street muscians play during the evening on to our room, but we did not mind it, but you might do? He did not play all night long so it was no problem for us. The room was clean and had what we needed. The breakfast location was really great and the view really good. They had a lot of selctions of breakfast items. We did no use the roof terrace or the pool, but the pool is a little smaller than it looks in the pictures. But great for a cool down i guess. Only complaint i have is that we arrived really late, and the receptionist lady was going to explain where the parking garage was, she was a little…

title: EXCELLENT LOCATION, FANTASTIC HOTEL
review: Just returned from a week at this Hotel. This is probably the first Hotels ever that I have stayed in that I can't think of any complaints at all ! Extremely good location right in the centre of the town. Wonderful Lake views. Bedroom was fine, reasonable size and nice bathroom with a bath as well as shower. The service was good throughout the Hotel. However the best thing of all was the WONDERFUL FOOD ! Breakfast was plentiful. Evening meal was outstanding, 4 courses-salad bar, 1st course usually pasta or soup or juice-main course of meat, fish or veggie and amazing desert buffet ! Great to sit on the terrace having dinner overlooking the Lake. i am a perfectionist and find one of two complaints wherever I stay but at the Europa NONE AT ALL !

title: Great Hotel
review: Loved the Hotel Europa in Riva, it was absolutely spotless super clean. Friendly helpful staff who worked 24/7. The rooms are a great size nice and modern. Hotel is in a fantastic position overlooking the lake and square where there are lovely bars,  and  restaurants surrounding the area. The ferry is directly opposite to take you to different destinations around the lake. The hotel has a small rooftop pool which is an added bonus and a lovely sun bathing deck. The food is Amazing with a fantastic choice even the pickiest eater would be able to find something they like. The only thing I would ask of the management if I returned would be to sit at a table of 2 for breakfast and dinner as they put our table next to another which is quite annoying as having to make random…

title: Really good stay
review: Dear Surfgirl67,   thank you for sharing your experience, it looks like you really enjoyed your stay. If you return to our hotel, feel free to ask in advance for a table that isn't too close to the other guests; our maître Paolo will be more than happy to accommodate your every need. We hope to welcome you back very soon! Kind regards.  The Management

title: Beautiful hotel.
review: Just returned from 1 week at this hotel. Very, very enjoyable - stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. Good choice of breakfast from buffet. Lovely room overlooking harbour. Very clean and well presented. Great staff - even before we checked in they had helped book taxi transport to and from airport and had booked us on an excursion to the Dolomites. Next time we go to Lake Garda, we will look to book this hotel again and we are certain that we will have another great week.

title: Just brilliant
review: Typical Italian family run hotel. The food was first class. Could not which for a better hotel on the lake. Only 50 yards and you are boarding a boat that will take you round the lake. Plenty of free entertainment in the square ever night.

title: Nice location
review: Se spent three nights here in a deluxe lake view -room. The view was nice. If you want to spend a quiet evening in your room, this might not be the best choise for your room. There were artists playing and singing at the piazza and infront of the hotel. This didn’t bother us. Our room was smaller than we thought it would be. It was ok, but nothing special. Breakfast was good.   There was a very small pool on the roof. It was too small to really go swimming.   I would say that the location and view were beautiful, the hotel itself was average.

title: Great location
review: Stayed there for one night. Excellent location directly on the lake. Superb breakfast buffet with a beautiful view. Room was a bit dark facing the road. Central air condition. The receptionist was very friendly. We were allowed to park our motorcycles on the enclosed car park at no extra charge.

title: Location location and location!
review: Wonderful Hotel in the best location... just on the lake and the ferry terminal  So much happening around it... lovely cafes and restaurants!! The room was very clean with a lovely view from the balcony! Breakfast was excellent!! And the staff very helpful and friendly.. Loved it... Will surely be back!!

title: a trip to lake garda
review: A nice hotel which is very handy for the lake and its ferries. Bar outside with 10% discount for guests. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The only downside which results in 4 stars not 5 is the shower over the bath. The bath is narrow and curved base which means a it can be quite slippy  whilst showering and dangerous climbing in and out.

title: A Delightful and Peaceful Setting
review: We spent a week here on a Riviera holiday in late May, early June 2018 and were very pleased with many aspects of the hotel.  We had paid extra for a lake view room and requested a balcony.  This proved really good and the location overall, as seen from the photographs of the hotel, was idyllic.  The square outside the hotel was not busy or noisy yet the closeness of large pedestrian areas alongside the lake made you feel part of the activities with visiting musicians and entertainers contributing well to the atmosphere.  External noise was not intrusive and the air-con, although a little noisy, was effective.The room was small but adequate but the bathroom was disappointing with a small and cramped shower area over the bath.  The bed was fine and there was sufficient storage…

title: Amazing hotel in a beautiful position on the lakeside.
review: Stayed here for one week in May.  Food is excellent with plenty of choice.  The restaurant has a beautiful lakeside position.  We also chose a lakeside room which had an outstanding view.  We certainly would stay at The Europa again and it is highly recommended.

title: Lovely place and location
review: Came here for morning coffee on the pavement, beautiful hotel and location, priceless view looking out over the water. Staff were very good and friendly and the prices were reasonable. This is definitely a hotel we would consider for our next trip to Garda

title: A lovely hotel in a great location
review: This comfortable hotel is located overlooking the harbour in the beautiful old town area of Riva. It is well maintained, very clean and the food is good. The staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. We had a room at the back of the hotel and there was quite a bit of traffic noise starting early in the morning, but we didn't notice it at night.

title: A Wonderful Riviera Holiday at this Fantastic Lakeside Hotel
review: We had a week at this hotel in a standard room which had comfortable contemporary Decor with a limited view of the Lake, but wished we had upgraded to a Lake View Room.  The Hotel is centrally located in the old town next to the harbour and main square in fact you could not find a better location in Riva Del Garda.  The Restaurant on the first floor has stunning lake views and the food is outstanding the Chef must be one of the best in the region and turns out moorish food which definitely ruins one's diet and often puts on local delicacies. The hors D'ouvers and breakfast buffet are outstanding While Paulo the head waiter and his team are gems that the hotel owners should treasure as the are an invaluable asset. We had a early departure on our final day , and Paulo ensured we…

title: An amazing holiday!
review: Dear travellingman2150, thank you for the beautiful review! Wa are very pleased that you enjoyd the holiday here, even thanks to our staff, that with the receptionists, the waiters leaded by Paolo and the kitchen staff makes all the best day by day for the happiness of the guests. We wish you all the best hoping we can say "Welcome" to you all one more time next year. The management.

title: Returned Again
review: 12 times we have spent 2 weeks in Hotel Europa for a summer holiday. It is in the best location in the true heart of the town. Located on the harbour side, handy for the boat trips down the lake and surrounded by a variety of bars and restaurants and the best Gelateria is right below. All the photos are taken from our balcony.   The hotel staff are without exception, brilliant. Everything is conducted in a professional and friendly manner and they strive to achieve everything asked of them. The breakfast buffet provides a wide array of foods that only the most pernickety could fault. My wife is an awkward eater but she always enjoys breakfast. We don't take the evening meal as we prefer to eat at different restaurants each night. However, reports of the dinners are very…

title: Fabulous location
review: Great hotel in the centre of town. Friendly staff. Choice on menu not always my taste but was well presented.  We had a room at the back which was quiet but just a street view but our kids had a view right over the lake which was beautiful.

title: October week with Riviera travel at Europa hotel.
review: Lovely week at the Europa with Riviera Travel touring each day.  Hotel was lovely,  sea view rooms nice but not much of a balcony only couple with table and chairs available and big enough to sit out on so be specific on your request. Lovely and clean, bath robes and slippers, take little kettle etc with you otherwise you need to wait til restaurant opens. Food lovely though if you don't like what's on the menu you can ask for something else. Trips out were very good though not a lot of time in Venice, you are offered the gondola trip which was very good value but it was done in middle of your day so limits your time to see other things, but their directions etc on where to meet and times etc with maps clearly marked were very good as we were all a little worried we'd get lost !…

title: Good stay here with Riviera travel
review: Beautiful setting in Riva Old Town.  We had asked for a lakeside room and were pleased to find we had a balcony..............the downside of this was when the next door guest's cigarette smoke would waft into our room.  Bathroom well fitted with over bath shower and bidet.......... although I think anyone a bit weighty might find the bath small. A welcome touch was complimentary white slippers and the use of bath robes.  We were seated in the conservatory dining area which overlooked the harbour which was wonderful.  Breakfast is OK although fresh fruit salad not always fresh i.e. I don't think melon should taste fizzy (fermenting)  My husband liked to boil his own morning egg to his own preferred softness. There's a wide range gluten free food. Dinner offers a buffet to start…

title: Great restaurant in s beautiful hotel
review: Great location on the lake with a restaurant unique for a hotel! I have been here for work and with family many times and I have been always surprised by the high quality of the restaurant and the kindness of the staff. InSeptember they offered the regional food of Trentino like strangolapreti, canederli, trout, carne salada, ecc... a great dinner which you would not expect in a hotel! Thank you to the staff and to the chef Valerio.

title: Riva Del Garda..a traffic free zone
review: We spent an 8 day holiday with Riviera Travel,using our base as  the excellent Hotel Europa. This was a 4 star hotel with clean comfortable bedrooms.The Dining  facilities  Were in a beautiful restaurant overlooking the Lake and the Square.. Great to watch the  Boats coming and going while we were having our meals !The starters and Main Course Were silver service with several choices. The dessert was buffet style..so much to choose from! Breakfast choice ranged from Cereal, eggs and bacon to fruit ,yogurt etc The Waiter service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. Price of the holiday Included Day trips to Venice (an excellent day out!)Verona,The Dolomites and a tour round the lake. The guide was excellent and  all in all the holiday was very good value  for money

title: Beautiful hotel in great location
review: The hotel is larger than it appears from the lake - it's not just the blue building with the "hotel europa" sign on the top but it includes the buildings on either side of it as well. It clearly caters successfully to large groups. We traveled as a couple but there were groups from the UK as well as some corporate group in a conference room listening to who-knows-what.  The common areas are quite attractive and the breakfast room includes a terrace that overlooks the lake. It is extremely sunny there in the morning, so go with your sunglasses. Breakfast is good, with many choices including gluten-free pastries. I found the croissants somewhat dry, but everything else was good.  The room we had was a "deluxe lake view" and it had a very nice balcony. WiFi worked everywhere except…

title: This hotel is a "keeper"!
review: Great location, and the staff were very polite and helpful. Food was fantastic - we were on a Riviera "accompanied" tour and had buffet breakfast and dinner included, and it was excellent. We also found it a real treat to eat in the beautiful dining terrace. We'd paid extra for a room with a lake view, and if we stood on tip-toe on broken floor tiles yes we did have a lake view. But that really is a minor niggle, if and when we return to Lake Garda and indeed the town of Riva, we'll definitely stay at the Europa hotel.The roof terrace is also beautiful and the pool on the roof is really not much more than a plunge pool but all in all, this hotel provides a great all round package and made for a very pleasant stay.

title: Great location great care
review: We went to this hotel on a Riviera Travel hotel and were very pleased with the room,food, and the general care given by the hotel. From the outside it is a old traditional building, which hides what appears to be a new building Inside. Within this comfortable environment, we enjoyed a good menu and service by the restaurant staff, a room which was serviced daily including very regular changes of  bedding and towels. We had a large clean modern bathroom, a large TV which was a little light on English programmes. There were facilities that we didn't use due to our being on a tour and being out for five of our seven, also being right by the harbour and lake we spent time exploring the old town and lake. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Returned Again
review: 12 times we have spent 2 weeks in Hotel Europa for a summer holiday. It is in the best location in the true heart of the town. Located on the harbour side, handy for the boat trips down the lake and surrounded by a variety of bars and restaurants and the best Gelateria is right below. All the photos are taken from our balcony.   The hotel staff are without exception, brilliant. Everything is conducted in a professional and friendly manner and they strive to achieve everything asked of them. The breakfast buffet provides a wide array of foods that only the most pernickety could fault. My wife is an awkward eater but she always enjoys breakfast. We don't take the evening meal as we prefer to eat at different restaurants each night. However, reports of the dinners are very…

title: Great for a girlie trip
review: The hotel was in a perfect location by the lake within walking distance of restaurants and all amenities. The ferries were 2 minute walk from the hotel. The room we had was great, we had a lake view and could also see the square, small rooms but adequate. Safe, fridge and TV. No kettle though but we managed without one.  The sky pool was a welcome relief after some trips in the heat, small but fine. The breakfast was next to none. The evening meal had a good choice. Something for everyone. I don't understand the table allocation thought, didn't that happen in the 1970s??  Paulo was kind enough to accommodate us though (I think the tour operators get first dibs on the tables) Clean, tidy hotel also free WIF, I would definitely recommend.

title: Depends what you are used to
review: There are some very good things about this Hotel. It is in a superb position. The rooms are reasonable but missing some of the niceties of what I expect from a 4 star. No tea or coffee facilities. Free water only available on first night. No tissues. Basic toiletries. No glasses in the rooms, only thin plastic cups.  The staff were generally very good. The food was hit and miss. Some nights it was excellent, some not so good. In my opinion the veal stew was inedible. Last night buffet was excellent. They do not know how to cook vegetables. Wine prices were very reasonable. The sky pool is about 1 metre deep. Noisy air conditioning.

title: Staff is THE BEST! Located in the middle of the action + on the lake
review: Everyone on the staff was super helpful and friendly. We have a lot of sporty equipment and there's a big, safe bike storage room. Parking was easy and inexpensive. The room itself is comfortable, maybe a bit cramped (fridge is toooo tiny), but to be expected when it overlooks the main plaza and is on the lake. There are lots of food choices and it's thoughtfully prepared. There's a juicer at breakfast with veggies and ginger. Wait staff remembered us and our preferences from the first day (we stayed 4 nights). Only problem was that my bike frame got some nasty scratches from the bike storage locks because the padding didn't stay in place (bike locker #49).   Can't say enough about the staff—they're so nice and chill and accommodating—really makes all the difference.

title: Amazing
review: Dear Sporty Girl, thank you for your top score review! We are very glad to read that you enjoyed everything here during your stay. About the bike locker #49, we fixed it: thanks a lot for your suggestion! We hope to see you soon again at Hotel Europa. Kind regards from Riva, the Management

title: Perfect position
review: This is not our first trip to Riva Del Garda, but was our first time at Hotel Europa.  If I could have given more than 5/5 I would.   We stayed here as part of a European driving tour having driven from Austria.  On arrival, parking outside the hotel was full so we had to go into Riva park up and walk.  This is my one an only criticism as once we had checked in and parking permit issued, we were able to get the car firstly outside the hotel entrance to unload and then up to the hotel car park.  The parking was fine and had a great view of the lake (level 6 of the multi story car park).  We stayed in room 206 which was on the 2nd floor with a lake view.  The room was very clean and comfortable with a small fridge, air conditioning and a good size safe.  The view from the room…

title: A perfect location by the lake
review: This hotel is situated in a perfect location. The ferry is 2 minutes walk and there are countless bars, restaurants and shops close by. The car park is 100m away and you need to reserve a space. Our room had stunning lake views and we looked forward to relaxing on the balcony with a cup of tea. Unfortunately there was no tea/coffee making facilities which surprised me as I have never been to a hotel before that doesn't provide this in the room. Also, it is not possible to borrow an iron so take a travel one if this matters to you. Or you can use the hotel laundry/ironing service. We sent a couple of things for washing and they came back 24 hours later nicely washed and pressed. Pool is tiny - more a dip in to cool off facility than anything else. Beds were 2 singles pushed…

title: Lovely hotel, lovely holiday
review: A big thank you to everyone at the Hotel Europa for a wonderful holiday experience. Our room with a lake view (203) was perfect with free safe and excellent Wifi, fridge, gorgeous bed and spacious bathroom. The position of the hotel on the lake and the view from the room were magnificent, the food was of such high quality with plenty of choice. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Pauline, our travel guide with Riviera Travel, was exceptional. Altogether a wonderful holiday.

title: Great location, average rooms, no atmosphere.
review: The hotel is in a fantastic location, it's situated on the lake, close to ferry, lots of restaurants nearby and a great bar underneath. Our room was extremely clean and the house keepers visited daily.   We had a superior lake view room. Unfortunately though there had been no photos of the room when booking.. The room was one of four rooms located in the hotels roof. The room was spacious and the bathroom was was fine. The room itself was very plain and dark. The darkness came from the fact the balcony was built into the eaves of the roof. The balcony was surrounded in dark wood and had a dark wooden roof. There was a table with two chairs which was nice, but when seated it was impossible to see the lake or the mountains. The view when standing though was beautiful!   The…

title: Good hotel
review: The location is excellent. We had a room which overlooks the lake. The ferries and bars  are less than one minute away, although it can get noisy at night. The rooms were clean , with air con .  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good - fruit , eggs , breads etc . Our party had mixed views on the food - it was good but not brilliant

title: Perfect location in a gem of a place called Riva del  Garda
review: The hotel was in a perfect location by the lake within walking distance of restaurants& shops. Also the ferries were just coupe hundred yards from hotel. The room we had was cosy but adequate. Safe, fridge& TV. No kettle though but we managed without one. Plenty of tea& coffee. We had a view of the mountains& The Bastian. The sky pool was a welcome relief after some trips in the heat. The breakfast was next to none. The evening meal had a good choice. Something for everyone. Clean, tidy hotel with friendly staff. Also free WIFI

title: All you need, in just the right spot!
review: We stayed there on the recommendation of Riviera Travel and paying a small supplement, and it was well worth it!  We were on a higher floor with a sort of semi-balcony tucked into the roof which gave great views of the lake and of the town waking-up in the morning. The conservatory style dining room was a lovely and bright spot for breakfast, and there was plenty of choice, including Prosecco to start the day right! Dinners were varied with a gala evening for something a bit more special.  Restaurant and Reception staff were universally friendly and helpful. Don't be put-off by the proximity of the hydroelectric station - it is inaudible, and the pool and sunbeds are of limited utility due to their modest size and the shadows cast by the mountain.  Traffic noise is reduced by…

title: A hotel with a view
review: This hotel is in an amazing position at the head of Lake Garda just near the harbour where the boats are .  We have now stayed here twice and love it.  You do need to pay extra for a lake view but it is not expensive and is definitely worth it.  The breakfast is fantastic.  There is the opportunity to boil your own eggs (timer provided!) and squeeze` your own fresh juice or vegetable smoothie.  There is plenty of choice of all kinds of breakfast food too.  The evening dinners are excellent with plenty of choice and an amazing sweet buffet.  The hotel is ideally situated in the town near to everything.  We would never stay anywhere else and we intend to return. We went with Riviera Travel both times.....will use them again too

title: Great hotel, interesting meals and beautiful central location
review: The location in my opinion can't be bettered - 30m from the ferry/overlooking the main square and close to many attractions/bars/reastaurants in riva.  This may look like an old hotel but I believe it to be a modern building behind an older frontage.  The rooms were clean and modern and the ensuite sufficient if not the most luxurious we've had.  Room safe, fridge and tv are included.  we had room 122 at the rear of the hotel so nominal road noise only.  Our grown up kids had room 309 on the top floor with balcony overlooking the square ( I think I got the rooms the wrong way round!!).  The sun terrace has a view over the lake but the pool is tiny.  Food was  interesting and mostly of good quality and varied with 2 courses served plus buffet starters and desserts.  This should…

title: Great restaurant welcoming staff
review: Dear Lawrence, thank you for your top score review! As you said, despite the classic frontage of the hotel, the rooms and the common areas are completely renovated. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay in Riva and we hope to host you again at Hotel Europa! Kind regards, the Management

title: Fantastico!
review: You do not expect such a good restaurant into a hotel: great buffet , special menu, Trentino dinner, professional and welcoming staff. I love the gnocchetti trentini, risotto at erba ursina personally picked by the great chef Valerio on the Dolomites Alps! The front desk staff is great and helpful  Thank you! I will come back in the fall!

title: Perfect place for a break
review: The Hotel Europa is perfectly positioned on Lake Garda, close to the lake, moorings, and the lovely town. The room was a little small, though very comfortable with excellent bathroom, but we didn't mind as we spent most of our time out exploring, eating really good breakfasts and evening meals, or sitting in the comfortable lounge. The staff were without exception polite, willing and helpful and added massively to our enjoyment of a wonderful week in a really nice region of Italy

title: All about the Location
review: Stayed at the Hotel Europa, in June, fantastic position on the Square and over looking the lake. The food was excellent with many choices. Breakfast the same. Ask the Head maître d ( Paolo) if you are Vegetarian, and he will concocted something for you. The rooms were spacious and maid service everyday. A.C. was free and welcomed. Maybe take a travel kettle with you as no facilities in the bedrooms. Riva Del Garda has many good restaurants and bars and from here is good for boat trips around the Lake

title: Fabulous Hotel with amazing lakeside view
review: Dear Neil B, thank you for your comment! We are glad you enjoyed your holiday on Lake Garda thanks to the beautiful location and to the people working at the hotel: we are proud of our staff. We hope to host you again in the future. Kind regards from Riva del Garda, the Management

title: Location, location....
review: Fantastic hotel with friendly helpful and very efficient staff. Food was excellent. Breakfast buffet and Dinner were both excellent with plenty of choice including wines at a reasonable price.  MD Paulo and his team were superb, full of charm, humour and very helpful. Our room was very comfortable and spotless - it had a balcony with a view of the lake. It was not near any main corridor so was quiet but be aware that with the windows open there is noise from the bars below and around the hotel environs, not that we were worried by this as it added to the atmosphere in the evenings. There was good WiFi in the hotel if you want to keep in touch with the outside world.

title: Lovely location
review: Dear christchurch, thank you for your comment! We are glad you habe a wonderful stay. As you said, the atmosphere here on lake Garda is simply special and we will be glad to share your pleasure with the maitre Paolo and all the staff! Kind regards from Riva, the management

title: Amazing Hotel facing the lake
review: We went on a trip with Riviera Travel. I recommend this hotel the food was excellent the staff were friendly and the rooms were clean. We paid extra for a lake view which was well worth the money. A lovely week in a lovely place. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you Bev and Caroline from Riviera travel a great week.

title: Lovely hotel perfect situation
review: Dear Angie H, thank you for your comment! We will share it with our chef Valerio and all the staff: we are really proud of our team and we are glad you appreciated their courtesy. We hope to host you in the future! Kind regards, the management

title: Always an enjoyable stay Riva Del Garda.
review: Great hotel with amazing breakfast buffet.  The housekeeping is first class and reception staff very friendly and efficient.  The free bicycles were in perfect condition.  We had a lakeside room which was nice as it had dual aspect windows keeping it cool.  Friends faced the other way complained their rooms although nice were hot and didn't seem to have air conditioning.  Car park was secure - other than wishing it had had tea and coffee making facilities we could not fault it and would return again if in Riva.

title: Bellisimo
review: Dear Coogie, thank you for your review. We are glad you liked your stay and appreciated our staff: we are really proud of them and their hard work! Speaking about the air-conditioning system, the hotel has it, but due to city laws it cannot be turn on before the 1st of June. All the best from Riva del Garda, the management

title: Apart from no kettle, excels in every way
review: Visited this hotel for a week on a package tour with Riviera Travel. Having stayed in Riva Del Garda before I requested and paid extra for a lakeside view. The room was clean with bath shower and bidet. There was a good sized (free) safe in the room, there was a fridge included, along with bathrobes and slippers. Take a travel kettle with you as it is great to watch the world go by from the room. WiFi was fantastic, we took the amazon firestick and it worked fine though we only watched a couple of things on it. Breakfast was extensive with lots of choice. Dinner was ordered in the morning and had a choice of 3 starters and mains and was of a high standard. Wine list had good choice and was reasonably priced. Staff are really friendly and approachable. The room was cleaned to a…

title: Heaven
review: There's not one thing I can fault about this hotel, ALL the staff are brilliant. It's just a step away from everything, I can't fault anything! The staff are all fantastic, behind reception, in the dining room, everywhere

title: holiday
review: Dear sydeney17, thank you for sharing your experience! Hope to host you again in the future. Kind regards from all the staff, the management

title: Delightful in all respects
review: Hotel Europa  At First was disappointed in the room I booked a lake view from the pictures in the  brochure which showed the main hotel the blue building in the middle we were in the dark red building to the left  no balcony  room drab and view excellent but you had to stand to see it with your glass of wine before you went out on the night time excellent staff   very good position  excellent walks around Riva and very good ferry location out side door good small  pool on roof

title: Lovely place
review: Dear keith I, thank you for your comment! You are right, the location of the hotel in downtown Riva is the perfect spot to walk around, go shopping or take a boat trip. The ideal room to enjoy lake view while sitting on a balcony is our deluxe room, instead of the superior room that you booked. Kind regards from all the staff, the management

title: WEEK BY LAKE GARDA
review: My sister, my daughter and I checked in the day the hotel opened for the season, Our apprehension was dissipated the moment we enter the hotel: it was in top shape, fully staffed, and ready to go. Even the rooms were already well ventilated and welcoming (often times at the opening of a season hotel rooms are damp and stuffy). We had a room with a view which was gorgeous. Stuff impeccable, professional, helpful, friendly. We had a "mezza pensione" , i.e., with breakfast and dinner. It was a great idea especially since the dining room overlooks the square and the lake front. Food remarkably good with a pleasant selection from the menu. Giusi, Massimo, Michele, all wonderful. Maitre d'hôtel (Paolo?), a treasure for the hotel.

title: Lovely 5 night stay.  Great Location and Staff!
review: We stayed for 5 nights in late September.  The location is great!  Very convenient to everything.  My wife's mother had stayed at the hotel more than a decade ago when traveling with an Elderhostel (now Road Scholar)  group.  We are so glad that she mentioned the hotel to us.The Hotel is right across from the Lake Garda Ferries.  The Tower, Museum, ancient sector of town, everything was nice and close.  We arrived by bus from the train station in Rovereto.  The central bus station/terminal was a walkable distance.  Easy walk for me and doable in less than 20 minutes for my wife, who has some knee problems.  Our room was fantastic.  We took the Junior Suite since this was a special vacation.  We loved the two room (and two bathroom!) setup.  Loved that the floors were hard…

title: Lovely location. Shame about some aspects
review: I have given this hotel review " very good" because it is in a beautiful location right beside the lake. Also it has a pleasant ambience with clean lines. It has been refurbished so the bedrooms are smart, clean and tidy with TV and a nice bathroom with bath and shower. Beds are large and room service is good with linen changed regularly.  What I think let's this hotel down is the food at the evening meal. Poor choice and not cooked very well. A lot of frozen food is used as are pretty prepared dishes. On saying that, the selection of breakfast items is excellent. Self service and as much as you like. Also I am very surprised that there is no bar in this hotel as they have a Bistro outside where you get a discount so no nice cocktail taken in the hotels nice surroundings before…

title: Lovely Hotel overlooking the lake
review: Visited this hotel for a week on a package tour with Riviera Travel.  Lakeside view room was clean, large and well appointed with bath and shower, bidet etc.  We were on a half board basis.  Breakfast was extensive with lots of choice. Dinner was ordered in the morning and had a choice of 3 starters and mains.  Wine list had good choice and was reasonably priced.  There was a hotel bar situated on the terrace outside and as residents we had a 10% discount on drinks.  All in all a very enjoyable stay in a beautiful location.  There is a rooftop poool though we did not use it.

title: more than we expected
review: Recently stayed at Hotel Europa with a party of eight friends. I had booked with Riviera travel the first time with that company. After this holiday it stands up there with the best.I was impressed with the fact that every detail was taken care of. Our representative at the hotel Pauline Ryley was outstanding. When i and my husband had trouble getting a return booking pass due to the foibles of Ryanair, she sorted it for us. Every place visited she informed on where to eat, where the toilets were, even what was good on the menu. Throughout our excursions we were given lots of history about the place we were visiting. she even rotated seats on the excursions so that everyone had a fair share of front and back seating. It did not bother our party but it was a nice gesture all the…

title: Top location, very comfortable
review: Great location, so it's probably worth paying the extra, as we did, for a lake view, it really is a treat.  The roof terrace is not quite as it appears in the photos, and the pool is actually quite small.  However, the room was as you'd expect from a hotel like this, fairly de luxe.  Slightly annoying was the air con that can't be totally switched off.  It's probably essential in mid summer, but at the end of September, it was nice and warm, just right to have the window open.  Parking is very handy and a must have if you're going by car, otherwise I don't know where you would leave it.  The breakfast buffet is a truly wonderful spread, a bit of everything, including Prosecco if you must.  You won't need lunch after this.   Riva del Garda is a lovely place to visit, the Europa…

title: Excellent lake views and cuisine to match!
review: Staying as part of a Tour group, charming staff, and dinner a delight every night, and I'm a vegetarian that doesn't often have such a lovely menu to choose from. Lake view rooms nice if not large but views make up for that. Ace location with old harbour just outside. Bars, restaurant parks all a few minutes away.

title: A lovely hotel with great view of the lake
review: Arrived at the hotel late in the afternoon. Beautiful location directly in front of the lake. The rooms were a little basic but nice. The breakfast was great. Most importantly the staff were really friendly and very helpful. Will definitely visit again if I go back to lake Garda

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: We couldn't fault this Hotel food was excellent plenty of variety staff so helpful and courteous the rooms are cleaned  everyday not a speck of dust anywhere.  I would have preferred a room with a view but we went on lots of trips so didn't spend much time in the room. I will definitely go back to the Europa again. Riviera Tours were excellent everything was organised so well and Nichola our Tour Manager was so organised and knowledgeable she made our tours run so smooth I think we chose the Best!

title: Almost perfect!
review: This hotel is in a great location beside the lake, the dining room having floor to ceiling Windows giving magical views across the water and there being convenient access to the pretty town and harbour. The staff are friendly and helpful and the food is delicious - particularly the hors d'oeuvres and desserts! Only disappointment was my (single) room (227). Bathroom was great but the room was narrow, no room for a bedside table, no bedside light, no picture on the wall to relieve the expanse of white wall, view of the internal courtyard. Luckily not spending much time there! Bed very comfortable, however, and double-glazing effective. Comfortable sitting areas downstairs. Very enjoyable stay.

title: Haven of peace
review: This is a wonderful hotel. Peaceful and tranquil. It is also has very welcoming staff, on reception, in the dining room, and keeping the bedroom spotless. The food was excellent. The location could not be bettered. All in all, the hotel would take some beating.

title: Everything here is perfect
review: This place has everything - location,cleanliness,excellent food, friendly staff and beautiful rooms.  You really couldn't ask for more.  Waking up (room 305) to a view of the mountains and lake.  Excellent choice of food, and lovely views while you ate in the conservatory dining room..  The roof-top pool area was spotless as well as having superb views.  Well done Europa ...a big thumbs up from us.

title: great location but that's all
review: Location of the hotel was very nice, hotel near the lake, with bar and restaurant in front of it. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with our room and staff of the main restaurant. If you want to stay on a balcony, you have to have half board, otherwise you have to stay inside because all the tables are reserved. Nobody told us that, but the waitress in the morning just told us that we are not allowed to sit there and when I asked why, she was just saying  something in Italian and we can say she was very rude to us. We had a feeling that are less worthy customers than the others as she behaved like this. The room was clean, bed was comfortable but in front of bathroom there was black smudge on the wall Afterall, we won't visit this hotel anymore. It was not as cheap as we were…

title: A wonderful holiday
review: We stayed at the Europa in 1997 and always promised ourselves that we would return one day. Well, last week we did return and we were not disappointed. The room was perfect, overlooking the harbour. The staff were all incredibly attentive and pleasant. The rooms were maintained to the highest standard on a daily basis. The food is from an absolutely traditional Italian menu - antipasto, pasta, secondi and dolce. The first and last courses are buffet style with an enormous choice and the others each are from a choice of four and are different every day. The restaurant staff were all excellent. The restaurant overlooks the harbour and, on warm mornings and balmy evenings, the windows are open giving a real alfresco feel to your meal.  The hotel now has a bistro with tables outside…

title: Excellent location
review: As previous reviews the hotel is in an excellent location.  We also had a table on the balcony for our stay and the choice at breakfast extremely good with plenty of fresh fruit and the ability to do your own orange juice and juicer.  We had a room in the eaves on the 3rd floor with a balcony but unfortunately when sat down could not see over the side.  The pool area is on the 3rd floor so nice and close for the sunloungers. Close to all amenities in the town, friendly staff and perfect for the ferries, all in all an ideal holiday base.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
review: Stayed in this hotel for a week with friends from 3rd September 2016. This hotel is located on the main square and within 2 minutes walk to the ferry terminals for easy travel to Limone, Malcesne and Torbole. The location is excellent in that shops, restaurants and gelateria are only a short and easy walk away. The hotel is spotlessly clean and all of the staff we came across were very friendly and helpful. We stayed half board and the breakfast and evening meals were very good indeed. We had rooms with a lake view and balcony and they were each of good size with good bathrooms (rooms 103 and 104 for reference). The hotel offers free WIFI which could be stronger but was better than a lot of hotels we have stayed at in the past. The hotel offers free bike loans for those who want…

title: Back Again!
review: This is our 11th consecutive summer holiday in Hotel Europa and 15th in Riva. We drive over from UK and make all arrangements independently.   Obviously we are a little biased in their favour because we keep coming back. There are better (more expensive) hotels, and many much worse. We just really enjoy this hotel. The service and staff are brilliant at all times. If anything is wrong it is quickly sorted.  Our room on the second floor had a balcony and a view over the Piazzas and Torre Aponalle, the harbour and the lake disappearing into the haze.  You have to pay a bit more for the premium Lake View rooms so decide what you want. These same views are available when you step outside of go up to the sun terrace on the roof.  Rooms are a good size, serviced daily and kept clean…

title: super lakeside hotel
review: Perfectly situated for lake steamers, main square and lakeside beaches. very friendly staff and excellent food.Rooms are fairly basic in furnishings but comfortable and very clean.Having visited other resorts on Lake Garda, this would be my preferred location as a base.

title: 10 DAYS AT THE EUROPA
review: Dear amitchell, thank you for your review! We are really glad you appreciated our staff and restaurant. We hope to host you again in the future. Kind regards from Riva, the management

title: Very good hotel and good stay
review: This was my second trip to Italy, Rome being the first. The coach trip from Verona Airport to the north of Lake Garda was about one and a half hours and the approach down to the resort gave us our first glimpse of the beautiful lake.  Reception staff at the Europa were efficient and courteous and I found my single room quite quickly. The room was spacious enough and provided all my necessities except tea & coffee making facilities. Luckily, I had brought my own, although it was rumoured that reception may have provided same.  We were lucky enough to be given a table on the balcony overlooking the town plaza which we kept for all our stay. The Hotel is in a very strategic position, right beside the Lake and its ferry services. Its proximity to the centre of the town is another…

title: Stunning Location
review: On arriving at the hotel, our first impression wasn't as favourable as it was when we left.  It comes across initially as a little outdated and quaint but that soon becomes part of its charm.  The room we were allocated had a lake view which was super albeit the room itself was a little spartan and the bathroom was ready for a face lift.  Having said that it was spotlessly clean and remained so throughout the stay, the room service was thorough and to a high standard every day.  Although our room was directly over a number of bars it was very well soundproofed with the window closed and noise was not an issue at all.  The reception service was very good and friendly and the hotel easy to navigate, the staff were knowledgeable and able to switch between languages very easily. …

title: Very good value...
review: This hotel is great value, the rooms are well kept, clean tidy and modern. Our room did not have a view of the lake, but was very light and airy, with good air conditioning. The Breakfast buffet was very good, with a very good choice of cereals, fruits, ham and cheeses, juices and hot scrambled eggs, bacon and mushrooms, boiled eggs you can do yourself. With a separate machine for all sorts of coffees and tea making facilities. The evening meals are fantastic, so much to choose from on the antipasta buffet, then you are served a second course, then a main course, if you can survive all that, there is a sweet buffet to die for !!  The staff are all very good, friendly and polite.... All in all a lovely hotel on the side of the lake.

title: Good hotel, great location.
review: Dear MIKE F, thank you for your comment! We know how important it is to start the day in good and energetic way: that is why we offer to our guests a rich and healthy breakfast buffet! All the best from the hotel staff, the management

title: Location, location, location
review: Hotel Europe is a comfortable clean hotel in a fantastic location on the lake front. Breakfast is served on a veranda overlooking the lake. Fridge in room, but no tea/ coffee making facilities. Bikes can be rented from hotel.  Roof top pool is small, but good for kids, and ample sun loungers.

title: holiday in italy
review: The Hotel Europa is at the heart of Riva and overlooks Lake Garda, only a few rooms have a view of the lake but there is a rooftop that has views and a tiny pool,  the breakfast room  looks out onto the square and part of the harbour.  The rooms are clean, air conditioned, nice bed linen there's a TV, mainly euro channels tho'.  .No tea/coffee making so take a travel kettle if you want to make drinks.  The lifts take you down to the square and there is a good bar right outside the door. The hotel food was very good indeed and the staff were lovely.  We stayed for a week on a tour with Riviera travel and would happily go back again.

title: Hotel in Ideal location
review: Dear Corleyweld, thank you for the nice words! The location of the hotel is one of our pride: you can easily reach the lake, the beach and many shops. Kind regards from all the staff, the management

title: Convenient location
review: We were on a journey around the south of europe with a rented car. So when looking for a convenient hotel with a parking garage, this hotel came up (there is a garage nearby). And what a nice hotel it is! Right by the harbour where all the restaurants and boats are. We got a room with a view right down to the harbour, the room was nice and modern (deluxe room) with every thing working well. The hotel has a small pool on the rooftop with sunbeds, however there were no bar or other service there. Good breakfast with the usual spread. I recommend the hotel, everything went nicely.

title: Hotel with a great location for all amenities, especially the ferries.
review: The room was small, but had everything we required, nice bathroom, all scrupulously clean. Since we only use the rooms in hotels as a place to sleep etc., it was perfectly adequate. The staff, without exception, were excellent. The food and the service were way above what you would get in some countrys for this type of establishment. I would have no hesitation about staying here again. The public rooms were comfortable and well equipped.

title: Old but elegant hotel
review: Nice room with balcony overlooking lake. Good food with waiter service. Pleasant,friendly staff. Extremely good position by lakeside and two minute walk into town. Very near to ferry terminal so lovely trips across the lake to different places.

title: Wonderful location
review: We thought the Hotel, though old was comfortable and the food was excellent especially the buffet antipasti. The staff were friendly and efficient. Our only problem was, that the area outside the hotel is full of noisy bars which went on quite late. The double glazing was very good but the air conditioning doesn't go on till mid June so it was a choice between getting hot at night, or having the windows open. The views over the lake right outside were amazing and the ferries go from there all over the lake. also easy to walk round the old town. Internet was good in the room.

title: Noisy But Does What  It Says On The Tin
review: Very functional hotel though lake view room on second floor very noisy. No air conditioning meant room was very hot and stuffy. Breakfast was good, room service for tea at any hour also very good. Location for all the local shops and bars was ideal as it was for the boats.

title: Could it be better - NO!
review: Just returned from a week at the Europa with a Riveria Holidays group. The Europa was fantastic, good rooms, great food and the staff could do no more. Position was good for exploring, right next to the lake boats. Not noisy at all. No hesitation in returning some day.

title: Wonderful Riva del Garda
review: We travelled with Riviera travel to Riva del Garda via Verona airport.  Well worth using this airport as it is so much nearer than Milan etc. and it is small and easy to negotiate. Europa hotel is placed right on the lake and has wonderful views, comfortable rooms and good food.  The staff are so friendly too. Our week with Riviera was well planned: we saw amazing sights and places. You need strong legs and feet - it is not a restful week but if you like towns and mountains this is the trip for you. My disabled husband coped with the help of a wheelchair when tough going but has so many happy memories. Our guide Christine was amusing and well-informed.  Our driver was very helpful and capable. We would highly recommend this company/hotel/holiday.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Dear Janet, thank you for your comment. We appreciate Your positive feedback on our our food and rooms. It is always a pleasure to know that we are on the right track.  We look forward to your next stay! Kind regards from all the staff. The management

title: Lake Garda tour
review: Stayed at this hotel on a Riviera Travel holiday.  What a great location right on the edge of the lake in a little harbour within easy walking distance to the old town and lake front walks. The rooms are lovely, clean and modern. Ours looked out onto an inner courtyard but was still very pleasant even though we didn't have a lake view. We stayed for a week and towels were changed daily and bedding also changed during the week. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the dining room staff.

title: Stunning Place
review: We could not find a fault with this Hotel we were in room 206 overlooking the lake wonderful views across the old Harbour the food was good plenty to choose from. the breakfast was plentyful with lot to choose from

title: Beautiful view and great location
review: Stayed one night in April in room which looked out front and had great view to the lake and main square. Room was clean and quite big, nothing fancy, but view really made it great. I believe you need to book one of the expensive category rooms to have lake view.  Breakfast was good and there is also nice lake view from breakfast room. Hotel has really central location, but they have also their own parking altough we were using one of garages maybe 10 minutes walk from hotel.

title: Great location
review: The back of the hotel opens to a nice plaza with many restaurants and shops it is also right on the lake with tour boats right there the room was clean and price moderate just a great location there is limited parking in their private lot make a reservation for a parking spit

title: Lakeside Delight
review: The hotel is right beside the lake. Some rooms look out to the front. Although we stayed in one of the rear rooms it was quiet, very clean and comfortable. All the staff were polite and helpful, speaking very good English. The restaurant is a conservatory type room on the first floor overlooking the lake. The delicious buffet breakfast set us up well for the day ahead. Evening meals were also good, but beware of ordering too much! Our only criticism would be that, as with  many European foods,they were a little too salty for our taste. A great place to stay as a centre for exploring the area.

title: Great location
review: Hotel central and handy for all amenities.  Boats/ferries to other locations on the lake - right outside the door.  Shops, restaurants etc all around.  About 1 mile walk to bus station.  Just a great location. Room fresh, clean and large comfortable bed.  Quiet at the back of the hotel - our room had a view of the mountains (no. 102), maybe not all rooms have this. Staff very friendly and helpful (particularly when handle on suitcase broke). Breakfast generally good - however toaster machine turned off and items not replenished on a couple of occasions after 9am (breakfast supposedly served till 10am).   Nevertheless would definitely stay here again.

title: Brilliant hotel, with lovely views of the lake!
review: This hotel is really lovely.  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  The dining room has a brilliant view over the lake and local square.  The food is excellent, there is so much choice.  It is in a good spot for exploring Riva Del Garda.  Excellent hotel all round.

title: Lovely hotel,location,etc,etc,etc.
review: This was our first visit to this part of Italy,and I'm sure it won't be the last. The Europa is is great place. The rooms were adequate, and serviced daily. We did not have a lake view but this was not a problem to us when you think how little time is spent in them. The only criticism is that there were no tea/ coffee making facilities in them. All the staff were really efficient, reception,waiting and bar staff could not be faulted. Food quality was lovely, and the panoramic restaurant was lovely. We enjoyed the " Happy Hour" between 5 and 7 pm was used regularly. Overall a great holiday, and we hope to return.

title: Overlooking Lake
review: Such a great place to have a holiday, the hotel staff are just great and they really look after you no problems with my gluten,wheat and lactose free diet they even got me in some lovely ice cream I could have. Would go back as it's so enjoyable.

title: first visit to Lake Garda
review: Wonderful experience through Riveria Holidays...great choice of hotel right by the harbour....food fresh, delicious & (a little too) plentiful as my waistband testifies too:))  Excellent staff, comfortable, clean bedroom with toiletries replenished daily....would be happy to return!!

title: Lovely staff and hotel, food perhaps not quite so good
review: Well situated by the port but surprisingly quiet, must have good double glazing. Staff very friendly and the hotel very well kept. Perhaps worth taking an extension lead if you plan to charge loads of kit as the plugs are fairly inaccessible. We had half board and the food is good but a bit too much for us, also the buffet not always replanished. Breakfast rather average.

title: Good location
review: We stayed here as part of a Riviera group in August this year. The hotel is undeniably in an excellent location, but otherwise for what is termed a four star hotel it was a bit disappointing. Yes, the food in the restaurant was good with a changing menu every day. The breakfast buffet was really very good and the staff were all really nice and helpful. The public rooms of the hotel apart from the restaurant were however a touch utilitarian. We were not in them much so this didn't matter but they did not give me a good impression. The rooms themselves are very bare and almost bleak. The towels in the bathroom should have been thrown away long ago they were so thin. The air conditioning was dreadfully loud and had no individual controls.  The other thing which I thought mean was…

title: Beautiful view lovely service
review: I would Stay here again most definitely Beautiful breakfast buffet with hot breakfast, yogurts, breads, croissants, fruit, coffee, Cappuccino and fresh juices. Great service. The room more than comfortable  nice bathroom  great hotel front desk service, happy hour, etc. all you need is Here. Rooftop pool is small but comfortable lounging seats to sun yourself. Would return

title: Location - perfect
review: This is our 10th consecutive summer holiday in Hotel Europa and 14th in Riva. We drive over from UK and make all arrangements independently.   Obviously we are a little biased in their favour because we keep coming back.  There are better hotels, and many much worse.  We just really enjoy this hotel.  The service and staff are brilliant at all times.  If anything goes wrong it is quickly sorted.  Our room on the third floor has a balcony and a view over the Piazza and Torre Aponalle, the harbour and the lake disappearing into the haze.  You have to pay a bit more for the premium rooms so decide what you want.  These same views are available when you step outside of go up to the sun terrace on the roof.   Rooms are a good size, serviced daily and kept clean and tidy.  Everything…

title: Wonderful location, friendly staff
review: We stayed five nights at this hotel.  We came as part of a package holiday from Canada and were thrilled to be given a lakefront view room on the third floor.  The room was comfortable, especially the beds, and it had a nice washroom.  Plenty of cupboard space.  We were at the front of the hotel so we could hear the music from the square but it never bothered us.   The reception staff were so friendly and helpful.  Thank you Michaela. Always a smile.   We chose half board and were extremely pleased with the dinners.  So much choice and variety and food was very tasty.  You choose your appetizers and dessert from the buffet and the 2nd and 3rd courses are served.  You choose your meal for the next evening and fill in a card.  Any wines, water, etc. is charged to your room. …

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: The Hotel Europa, similar to many Italian hotels, has spacious, elegant public rooms but basic bedrooms. We booked a superior room on a half-board basis, with lake view, which was clean, comfortable and well serviced by the staff throughout our stay. In fact the staff, from the minute you walk into the reception to register, were brilliant. Nothing was a problem and they were the friendliest bunch you are ever likely to meet. The location is fantastic for access to ferry boats, cycle and walking routes, visitor attractions, bars and restaurants. We thought we might eat out some evenings to experience different settings and food styles however, we dined in every night. The food and service were brilliant, not one bad dish or complaint.  We travelled around the lake to other towns…

title: A gourmet experience!
review: This hotel is amazing. The location at the edge of Lake Garda is perfect. The ferries to every corner of the lake are a few steps from the hotel. the staff throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful, the quality of food (half board) is exceptional and was quite unexpected! Riva Del Garda is a friendly, safe and buzzing resort... suitable for every age group. There is a huge range of outdoor activities nearby...serious cycling, water sports, climbing, walking etc etc. the hotel even welcomes dogs! There are quiet comfortable lounges and outside areas. A large sun terrace on the roof, with sunbeds and recliner chairs also has a small pool. All areas are exceptionally clean and well maintained. We booked with Inghams and thought the stay was excellent value.

title: Holiday
review: Went with Rivera coaches and the lovely holiday rep was Jackie she was very knowable.nice room wants a bit of TLC spending on it bathroom ok even though the shower screen not big enough. Food nice just wished they did more variety at breakfast and fresh veg with the Eve meal. Drinks not to expensieve bargain if you happen to get down for happy hour.please note they do supply you with a kettle teabags and milk if you ask at reception we didn't know about this till the day before we where leaving to come home.

title: Nice stay, perfect location
review: We stayed here for two nights during our stay in Riva Del Garda.  We had a nice room with a beautiful lake view, put the extra money in it! 😊  Very good breakfast in the morning, lovely to be sat on the terrace watching people in a slow pace on the outside whilst enjoying a glass of fresh pressed juice 😊  Very nice and helpful staff, hotel parking on the outside, excellent location in the heart of Riva.  We used the roof pool on our last day, not big but served its purpose to cool us down in the heat 😊  All in all a very pleasant stay 😊

title: great place, great food and a great location
review: With had half board and glad we did. Starting with diner, the food was amazing. Breakfast had everything plus more, a bowl with fresh veggies and fruits to make your own juice. I don't think I have seen a breakfast like that, it was amazing. The room had AC, bed was comfy, and we had a nice view of the harbour. Front desk was nice and friendly, got free bikes, a steam room and a small pool. There is a desert place downstairs that is a must for everyone .

title: Clean, good for storing bikes, but seems one of furthest hotels from swimming beaches in Riva
review: The hotel was clean and safe. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a bike room attached to the hotel where they rent and store bicycles.
