The hotel is next to the water but not really near the swimmable water. I had a bicycle and it seems like over a kilometer by the time you take the twists and turns to get to the beach.  The hotel is also within walking distance of the central plaza and many restaurants.

title: Super friendly staff and great location
review: Couldnt fault the hotel, staff, location and service !! We had a Lakeside view with a balcony, and certainly worth paying that bit extra to wake up to such beauty ! Really helpful and lovely staff ~ the food was really good ~ (if you don't opt for the hot breakfast on offer) ~ not really brilliant, but compensated by the choice of everything else. Fresh and healthy as well as beautiful cakes and pastries. Not at all noisy in our room ~ ( we were 2 floor ) and can't praise the staff enough

title: Be careful of the room you choose
review: We booked a Superior Lake View room and on arrival were given one of four in the roof.  It was horrendous - very dark  The balcony had two chairs but were you to sit down you would be looking at the balcony wall.  The view could only be seen by standing.  There was no view at all from within the room.  No pictures of this room appear on the hotel's website.  We know why!   We had no intention of staying in that room.  To be fair to the lady on the front desk we were moved to a Superior Lake View room on the first floor which had a window only, but was better - not quite what the picture shows on their website. The rooms are fairly basic but clean with comfortable beds and a very nice bathroom. The breakfast room is in a marvellous setting as is shown on their website.  The food …

title: Nice break on Lake Garda
review: We stayed for a week on a half board basis and had an excellent time.  Staff were very helpful.  We had a room overlooking the harbour and could quite easily have sat and watched the comings and goings all week.  It wasn't quiet but I enjoyed the hustle and bustle.  There were a lot of older people in the dining room, some groups who looked like they never seen food before, but thankfully we took it easy and there was plenty of food to go round.  Some nice pasta dishes as well.  If we were leaving early we could get an early breakfast and we enjoyed a few aperol spritz in the happy hour too!

title: Fantastic lake-front position
review: Also travelled with Riviera Holidays.  A lovely hotel in an ideal lake-front position, opposite the ferry and with cafes and restaurants on the doorstep.  We had a "standard" room which faced an inner courtyard, it was clean and comfortable without any frills, but was exactly as described on the hotel's website and in Riviera's literature.  We had decided not to pay extra for a lake view room because of previous comments on TA about noise from the cafes below, but guests we spoke to said this was not a problem as the soundproofing was very effective.  There were two very airy lounges with great lake views anyway.  The air conditioning in the room was a little eccentric, it automatically shut off at night unless you asked reception to leave it on, but once we discovered this it…

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night may 2015 room on our tour round lake Garda which was lovely cannot remember the room number but it was the room with the balcony over looking the harbour .  Had no problems with the room only that I found it hard to locate the plugs eventually found one behind the tv , I have seen comments about the noise coming from the bar which is below this room we did not have any problems but this could be that the weather was a bit wet and cool so maybe no music etc. breakfast  was very good really enjoyed you pay extra for the parking but it seemed to be a secure car park

title: EUROPA SHOULD BE EUREKA!
review: Traveled with Riviera Holidays, to this great Holiday Hotel and resort on Lake Garda. Situated at the head of the Lake with views over the lake and ferry Terminals. Good  accommodation, excellent staff, wonderful buffet breakfast and a great choice of evening meals in a relaxed and friendly and very clean Hotel. Wish we could have stayed longer!

title: SUMMER BLISS
review: We travelled with Riviera Travel to this glorious Resort. Perfect location for travelling around the Lake and the many Tourist attractions. The Hotel situated opposite the Ferry terminal always a fascinating experience people watching and sitting in one of the many lakeside Restaurants. Dining in the Hotel for breakfast or evening meal overlooking the Harbour, with a wonderful choice of menu and brilliant staff for whom nothing was to much trouble. Overall a great place to stay.

title: great service
review: We recently had a group stay at Hotel Europa.  The staff was very accommodating.  Michele at the front desk was helpful every day.  His English is perfect and he helped with everything from directions to amazing restaurant reservations and was always pleasant.

title: Very good hotel in a Beautiful Location
review: The hotel was just perfect for a couple's first holiday abroad together. Not all the staff spoke the best English, but that didn't hinder anything. They are really helpful and approachable. The rooftop pool is only small, but a great place to relax and cool off. Views over the lake and square are fantastic so throw open your windows and let the atmosphere fill the room! Wonderful when there are musicians outside the restaurant next door! The dinners available are beautifully cooked, and there are some familiar dishes. Breakfast is filling and plentiful. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel to start off our travels together!

title: Outstanding staff
review: Despite not speaking any Italian whatsoever, we got by fine because staff were absolutely charming and tried very hard when speaking English with us. Swimming pool on the roof lovely, welcome lovely, coffee on the house when we arrived outside on the little terrace. Room a little tired although it had a fabulous view of the lake and square... having said that, the bathroom more than made up for the room being slightly tired. Breakfast was great. All-round lovely experience. Free parking for our motorcycle too, behind a safe gate. Receptionist - an older Italian lady - could not do enough for us. Grazie!

title: Europa hotel Riva Del Garda
review: First time at Lake Garda we stayed at the Hotel Europa ,fantastic location paid extra for a lake view well worth the money we stayed in room 105 magnificent view of the Lake from balcony .Staff very good nothing was ever a problem ,food was first class with many choices would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Lake Garda.

title: Riva very nice
review: We returned from Europa a few days ago. We had booked a room with a view of the lake and were put in 109, after the first night we asked to be moved as the noise from the pub below went on until 1.30am. We were moved to a room at the side which was a little better although the noise from the recycling collection van at 7.30 makes sure you don't get to sleep in.   The food in the hotel is average and you have to choose what you want for your evening meal the night before.   On a plus side it was nice to be able to go for a walk around the town in the evening and we always felt very safe.  The staff are friendly and we met some lovely people from our tour and enjoyed their company very much.  Overall I would say DONT pay extra for a room with a view it's not worth it.

title: Riva is my favorite place!
review: We stayed at the Best Western Europa in Riva Del Garda for two nights.  The hotel was very nice.  We had a family room locate at the back of the hotel is on the main street, the room had two bathrooms. We eat two dinners it is much recommended.  The breakfast and the diner serve on the balcony view of the lake is beautiful, and the food very good to start the day and the evening. The girls  at the front desk are very helpful and friendly. The pool with a large deck and lots of lounge chairs on the roof top is great. The location is just perfect on a lovely piazza. We had car so we park it with the hotel garage arrangement it cost 7 Euro for night, It is my second time at this area and Riva is my favorite place! I recommend to taka bike to travel along the lake Riva have lot of…

title: Room with a view!!!
review: We returned 3 days ago having spent 10 nights at the Europa. I agree wholeheartedly with the review from "TriploverIreland" with a few exceptions. We were fortunate to have an excellent corner room on the 1st floor above the dining room. We also had a large balcony and looked over to the Ferry Terminal, the lake, harbour and to our left front the piazza. Apart from the tower clock chiming the 1/4 hours etc.which stopped at 11pm till 7am. we only had one night that was a bit noisy till 01.30 and all the other nights quiet by 11pm,ish. Our room facilities were very good with a quite large powerful shower over the bath with plenty of hot water. Plenty of storage and a spotless room. The food was of very good quality and well presented. Dinner served by well trained and friendly…

title: Great location
review: My husband and I have just returned from a seven night stay in Hotel Europa. We had a side room which was small and functional. However it was very comfortable, quiet and spotless. Rooms at the front are less quiet. There are electric power points in the room (other reviews talk of only power point in bathroom). They are covered by dark blue covers! We pointed this out to other guests who also thought they had to use the shaving point in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet had an abundance of fresh bread, croissants and cakes. Also cheese, a variety of cold meats, croissants, fruit, jam, honey, marmalade as well as cooked breakfast. I started each day with a glass of bucks fizz!  The reading room at the front of the hotel had French Windows opening onto the piazzo and overlooking…

title: Something that lets the hotel down
review: Myself , my husband and daughter stayed at this hotel for the week 15/9-22/9/14 ( 2 rooms ) Now I had seen the reviews on trip advisor after paying £ 59.00 per person for a lake view room so I asked for a highfloor room to avoid the noise. When we checked in we were allocated the 1st floor ( 107 ) , us at the front and my daughter at the back ( I did not pay for a lake view but was stuing £ 159.00 single suppliment ). On the first evening that it when it went downhill. We were over the pub at the front ( called no name pub ) and the music was still going it at 12.15 so I went down stairs to ask when the music was supposed to be turned off . The man on the night reception said 12 midnight and he went down stairs and asked them to turn it down which they did. His comment was no…

title: Just ok
review: Honestly this was my least favourite hotel I stayed in while traveling Europe.  I felt like I was in a dorm room from the 70's. Service was fine although they did try to charge me twice for my hotel room.  For the price it wasn't worth it.

title: Riva Del Garda Hotel
review: We stayed at the Best Western Europa in Riva Del Garda for four nights.  The hotel was very nice. We had three  family rooms.  There were four in each room.  One of the rooms had a small patio.  It was nice for enjoying the evening before dinner with a glass of wine.  The other two rooms had two bathrooms.  This was a special addition with teenage girls.  The breakfast room over looking the lake is beautiful, and the food very good to start the day.  The people at the desk were very pleasant and helpful.  There was a small pool with a large deck and lots of lounge chairs on the roof top.  We only ate breakfast at the hotel.  The location was perfect on a lovely piazza.  We had private transportation from Milan and they were able to drop us off in the back of the hotel.  The back…

title: Hotel Europa is the place to be in Riva Del Garda.
review: My wife and I stayed at the Europa Hotel in 2013 and enjoyed the experience so much that we told our friends about it and returned with them this summer to do the same holiday all over again. The location is first class, the food and accomodation is second to none and the prices are fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fantasic holiday that doesn't cost the earth.

title: Lake Garda in my view
review: We have just returned from an 8 day stay at the spacious Europa Hotel and enjoyed the great location, close to the lake and set in an historic piazza.  The staff are very helpful & polite e.g. printed out our airline boarding passes. The meals were 4 courses and there was an impressive buffet, for breakfast; at dinner, the Appetiser buffet was varied; pasta or soup followed, then a Main meal, with meat or fish and vegetarian option. Finally, the desserts were delicious, with plenty of fresh fruit, ice cream, and other Italian delicacies.  The bedroom was functional and very clean but lacked a beverage facility in the room - we had to ask for a kettle & plug it beside the basin, no other electric point. Next to the hotel are plenty of bars with wonderful cocktails & yummy…

title: Terribly overpriced for what is a basic 3 star.
review: We stayed at Europa for 3 nights, we thought the rate charge was far in excess of its worth having stayed in much nicer cheaper hotels in Florence and Rome. The rooms are very basic, drab and disappointing. On our first night there was a band outside the room until nearly midnight which kept us awake. Our bath plug didn't fit and although rectified meant we were unable to use our bath one night. The pool is an oversized paddling pool although the terrace itself is quite pleasant.

title: Location, location, location!
review: We have visited Riva Del Garda many times, but have not found a better location to be than Hotel Europa.  This years 2 weeks in August was our 9th consecutive stay here and we have also booked a return next year.  Perfectly placed on the lake/ harbour side and at the heart of the busy Piazzas.   We always make our own arrangements direct with the hotel and everything was perfect on arrival, even the exact room we had requested when we booked last year.  The hotel car park was full but the overflow is in a nearby multi storey.  A very short walk once you have unloaded.  This is actually a better option than the hotel car park as the €7/day is less.  The private hotel section has allocated parking space and is perfectly safe, secure, illuminated and clean.  It also much cooler…

title: Great location, not a 4 stars though
review: The location can only be matched by other hotels on the piazza, so very well located. Room was clean but small. Breakfast ok but without anything special (same jam, ham, cheese as in any other cheaper places, no fresh bread). Staff was courteous. Parking is conveniently located 50m away but you can park and drop off your luggages in front of the hotel. Overall ok but NOT a 4 stars by any mean, rather a 3 max. Location and price make it a 4, that's it.

title: Perfect Location
review: Beautifully situated hotel , converted from an old mansion and well modernised .Room was clean and comfortable if not very large ,bathroom was fine . Air conditioning worked well . The food was very good , an excellent selection at breakfast from the buffet , and four courses at dinner , all very enjoyable and the service was extremely efficient .The hotel is a few steps from the lakeside , very convenient for a stroll after dinner with many bars , shops and cafés nearby . We enjoyed our time there .

title: Great location at head of the lake
review: Super position with limited car park but arrangement with overflow only 100metres away 4 floor room for 3 with lake view B & B around £1350 for 9 nights in August Reception staff bit variable in helpfulness and not much enthusiasm for us to eat in hotel in restaurant overlooking the water as several tours had already booked half board HOWEVER slap bang in centre of busy squares with probably 30 restaurants within 5 minute walk so no great loss. Room (405) well decorated and always cleaned to god standard. Small pool & sun deck with only sporadic waiter service. Breakfasts reasonably good but again staff inconsistent in friendliness - tip is not to be afraid to ask same question to another staff member !!

title: Excellent Central Location
review: Just returned after spending 7 nights at the hotel.  The reception staff both on arrival and throughout my stay we're both friendly and helpful. The hotel room, was very clean and adequately furnished and included a safe and air con at no extra charge.  It overlooked the end of the lake and one of the main squares giving easy access to the town and the many narrow streets where you could shop, eat or just have a coffee or of course the Aperol Spritz, and watch various street artists.  Breakfast was buffet style offering a good choice of fruit, cereals, cheese, ham, various bread tools, croissants and buns. The hot breakfast was limited in that it was bacon, scrambled or boiled eggs.  Dinner was also very good with a buffet entree with a very excellent choice of salad, fish,…

title: Disappointing
review: I have stayed in best western hotels before and have not been disappointed until now! The hotel is in a prime location on the lake with stunning views.  However, the hotel itself was extremely disappointing. The rooms were very basic and definitely not value for money. The buffet breakfast was poor and service none existent, with the staff being very sullen.  I wouldn't book this hotel again although will definitely return to lake garda which was stunning.

title: Stunning location!
review: Excellent service in all departments of hotel ......rooms are spacious and have air conditioning....would recommend a room with a lake view...you can enjoy people watching from your balcony.....restaurant has stunning views of lake......boats to explore the lake are a few feet away...

title: Excellent location and value
review: We arrived at Riva Del Garda late afternoon in May, 2014 without a booking and 'happened' on the Best Western Europa. Due to the wonderful location right on the lake with restaurants and shopping right outside, we thought it would be fully booked. However to our delight, staff were very busy but found they had two rooms available both with lake views and the rate was more than reasonable. Rooms were comfortable and very clean, wifi was available, and the food in the restaurant excellent value.  Our only regret is that we could not stay longer due to our schedule. Would have no hesitation in staying again and recommending to fellow travellers.

title: Superb accomodation
review: Just back from a weeks stay at Europa with Riviera travel. Location of hotel is spot on, we had a room with a lake view which was excellent. Having read reviews before we traveled we were a little concerned, one review said that the waiting staff were surly. This proved to be far from true, all the staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The food was excellent and there was plenty of it, there was one exception, the "Gala Dinner", roast suckling pig was served  but considering that I do not like pork that was my hard luck. Would certainly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate in staying there again.

title: The restaurant is the star attraction
review: We chose the BW Europa on the basis of its location  - which is superb, but the star attraction was undoubtedly the restaurant. We travelled with Riviera who appear to have negotiated sole occupancy of the restaurant terrace / conservatory for their clients, the views from which were absolutely stunning and will live in our memory for many years. We have come to expect mediocre food from resort hotels, so we were very pleasantly surprised to find such high standards for both breakfast and evening meals, particularly the antipasti buffet which was always attractively displayed and very tasty. We had a room without lake views, and the room itself was adequate and comfortable, but not very attractive, which was initially disappointing, but the benefits of the rest of the hotel soon…

title: i should not tell you ,but `````````
review: just returned from a fabulous trip with Riviera travel staying at this superb hotel. excellent staff and wonderful food in the restaurant overlooking the lake. our room was large clean and comfortable and always plenty hot water in the shower. The atmosphere in the hotel was always most welcoming and relaxing and happy hour in the bar meeting with our fellow travellers was most enjoyable. Definitely the best hotel to pick of the 5 offered for this trip to Lake Garda. First class organisation and trips arranged by Riviera and a special thank you to our guide Antonia for her informative and humourous talks. ( her knowledge is amazing ! ) Found plenty of good local bars in eve with music and good places for eve walks stopping to enjoy a late ice cream or Aperol Spritz !

title: excellent value for money
review: Came here with Riviera Travel in May. Why anybody would give this less than a five I don't understand. For the money its excellent value.   Food always very good and plenty of it, rooms very clean and fresh towels every day. Reception staff very helpful e.g with local buses and connecting me to wifi. Waiting staff very good too and the wines were sensibly priced.   The location is stunning and anything you need including a small supermarket is less than five minutes walk away. No need to pay for a lake view as you spend so little time in your room. Riviera clients also seem to get the best seats in the dining room too!   I think one or two of the grumblers are expecting rather too much for the price we paid - would happily stay there again.

title: Great location
review: Stayed here on a Riviera holiday and it fitted the bill for our needs.  We hadn't upgraded our room and were glad not to have spent the extra cash when the trip was so full on - lots of trips and time on the coach.....  First time taking an organised holiday  - let us visit lots of different places in a short time frame but much prefer visiting as and when we want and not being herded!

title: Stay in garda
review: Stayed here late october with riviera travel, the hotel itself is in beautifull position right on the shores of the lake. I was rather dissapointed with the food especially the evening meal (as though the hotel was trying to save money on the food bill) The room we had was at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard, i found the bed very  hard. The staff in the hotel were most helpfull.

title: Great location and food - family of 5 in Riva del Garda
review: We stayed in Hotel Europa in early September 2013. The staff were friendly and helpful, the food as we had heard online was very good - we had big breakfasts out on a terrace overlooking the lake. It was spectacular. The dinner was also great and kids enjoyed all their meals. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The parking was about 50m up the road but convenient and safe. Hotel is very well located.

title: Definitely would go back
review: We were also here with Riviera Travel.  Fantastic location - food was terrific - especially the buffet breakfast.  Could not fault the hotel in any way and the service was excellent.  Had a room with a lake view - was absolutely stunning.

title: A disappointing stay
review: We came here with riviera travel. The location was excellent, right on the lake but apparently it was their last week before closing for the winter and things had run out. We asked for a baileys, no joy, a Tia Maria, no joy, a jack Daniels, no joy. Many of the wines were also out of stock. Your evening meal had to be chosen the night before, feeling like you were in hospital. The evening meal was 7 -9 pm. We quickly learnt that you had to be there at 7pm if you wanted your first course, which was a buffet, as when it ran out, which it did, it was not replenished. One of our main meals was given back due to very poor quality. We had a room with a lake view which was good except that there was no socket in the bedroom so the kettle had to be plugged into the only socket which was…

title: First stay at Best Western Hotel
review: We have recently returned from a week at the Europa Hotel Riva del Garda.  Best Western should be very proud of all their staff at the hotel from the very warm welcome at Reception with requests dealt with very efficiently and cheerfully.  The restaurant and bar staff and the chambermaid who were all very welcoming and helpful.  The whole team were very professional. The location is second to none located on the lake with bars, shops and restaurants all in easy walking distance. The views over the lake are memorable and we would certainly return to this hotel.  Lovely quiet room with no noise.

title: Lots to like
review: This hotel has a wonderful location on the lake with easy access to town highlights. We had a room overlooking the lake which, under normal circumstances would have been lovely. However, after September 15 the ventilation system is off and this makes the room stuffy. When you open the window all the noise from the cafes below comes in and this makes it hard to fall asleep or just have some quiet time. In our room the bed was in dire need of a new mattress but otherwise it was adequate. The staff were friendly and helpful. The big plus at this hotel is the much-better-than-expected dining experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the selections from the menu and the selection of antipasti was incredible. The breakfast buffet was also comprehensive. Just remember that if your back needs…

title: A lovely, friendly hotel
review: Having booked our holiday through Riviera Travel we were very pleased that we selected this hotel. Its situation is almost storybook perfect. We booked a lakeside room which gave lovely views over the square and the lake. The life in the square, with its cafes and clock tower, added to the atmosphere but this could easily be shut out by the effectiveness of the double glazing. The staff were always friendly, helpful and efficient. The room was comfortable and clean. The food was excellent throughout the week. We would happily return to the Europa.

title: Superb food and excellent staff
review: I stayed for a week on half board on a tour with Riviera Travel. Great value and a perfect position overlooking lake Garda.  The food quality and choice was superb for a 4* hotel and the staff particularly in the restaurant were excellent.  Rooms were good and alway clean and well kept.

title: Very Good Hotel in an Excellent Location
review: We stayed at the Europa Hotel with friends in July. We had a most enjoyable week, booked through Riviera Travel. When booking, all the lake view rooms were already booked, we were disappointed but overall it didn't really matter. Our rooms were a nice size with very comfortable beds, air conditioning and a good bathroom with plenty of towels. I do wish tea/coffee facilities were in the room, even if there had been a small charge for this. The breakfasts were very nice and a table in the balcony room looking at the beautiful view of the lake was fantastic. When I think of this image, it really does make me smile, I wish I could have bottled it and brought it home with me. We had a very nice table in the restaurant for evening meals. Most of the dining staff were polite and…

title: Great Location, Friendly Sevice - Great little 3 Star by the lake
review: We stayed here for a week in late August, early September. The location is perfect, right on the central square by the pier in Riva, a charming (albeit far from the most beautiful ) lake Garda town. The room was spacious, clean and perfect for a cheap and cheerful getaway. The only irritation was the fact that the double beds have two single mattresses, a trans continental annoyance! The breakfast was good and the service was exceptional. We also found that prices at the bar were exceptionally competitive (Prosecco at happy hour was 2€ a glass). There are no frills at Hotel Europa but nor do you feel you are in a truly budget hotel. The hotel also has its own sun deck and small pool which can be nice if the beach is busy. A great place to stay, thoroughly pleasant and relaxing,…

title: Excellent meals
review: We stayed a week on a package deal, and were delighted with the hotel. A fine continental selection at breakfast, with delicious meats, crusty breads, and a wide selection of cereals, fruits, yoghurts etc. A couple of hot things such as scrambled or boiled egg, but don't expect a full English (You really don't need it here). Pleasant staff. Each evening was effectively a 4-course, with a serve-yourself pre-starter from at least a dozen options, followed by the starter and main course served to you, and rounded off with your selection from the desert table. Meal times 19:00-20:30 are perhaps a bit early, especially if you've had a long day out. The town is delightful, but if you want to get to sleep early avoid the front rooms as the noise outside goes on until 11:30 or so most…

title: Wonderful views!
review: This was our third stop of our European tour, we had been to Venice last year but wanted to try another Italian location near the water.  The hotel confirmed by email a few days before that they had reserved a balcony room for us.  The room was fantastic and especially enjoyed our balcony view in the morning and last thing at night.  The hotel location was fantastic, right in the centre but found it a big noisy on Saturday night because the outside entertainment was still continuing after midnight. Other than that we had no issues at all, the breakfast choice was fantastic and plenty of different locations to sit and eat breakfast.  We were amazed at the amount of different seating areas around the hotel, the happy hour was also very enjoyable.  All the hotel staff were very…

title: Lovely place to stay.
review: We have just spent 4 nights at this hotel and leave very early in the morning. Unfortunately we didn't have a room with a view over the lake, however we looked up at the Bastile and I think it may have been quieter on our side of the hotel at night time. The staff were lovely and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We needed to leave at 4.30 in the mining and so a wake up call was organised along with some breakfast and a taxi to take us to the bus station for the 5.50 am bus to catch a train at 7.30am at Rovereto. Breakfasts were fine and filling and  it was very enjoyable sitting on the terrace overlooking the lake. Our room and bathroom were quite large and we had a comfortable chair to relax in.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Great position, lovely town with many restaurants, shops & tasteful entertainment. Hotel was clean & friendly and food was excellent. Shame the pool was only a plunge pool - a slightly bigger one would have made it perfect.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: The first time that we stayed at the Europa was in 1989! Like a recent reviewer we also have spent many happy weeks, always in a lake view room - probably out of the 25 years we have visited Riva about 15 or 16 times, and as Hoola13 said "always at the same Hotel"  Our paths must have crossed!  We have seen the previous family grow up and now move from the Hotel business.  The new managers are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them.  The food is excellent.  There is a help yourself salad/buffet before the starter which is beautifully set out.  The Gala Dinner once a week starts with a sparkly drink and vol au vents in the lounge.  The cook and kitchen staff must work very hard to produce such a wonderful range of food which is on offer each evening.  We booked in…

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: I have just returned from my 16th visit to Riva, 13 times at this Hotel!! (twice this year!) I cannot recommend it highly enough, The staff are wonderful, very helpful at all times and nothing is too much trouble for them. The food is excellent with a huge choice for dinner each evening and they hold a weekly "Gala Dinner" with live entertainment. The Hotel is spotlessly clean, spacious and bright with a lovely large lounge having open balcony doors overlooking the Piazzas and lakefront below. They have a "Happy Hour" between 5-7pm each evening with reduced price drinks, they also have bicycles available for guests to use free of charge. The Europa is in the perfect location and is ideal for less mobile guests too as everything is on the doorstep, also, the buses to the western…

title: Good location, but overpriced and not 4*
review: Spent one night in Best Western Europa in Riva during a weekend. Had limited options since most of the hotels were overbooked and Riva is an expensive place (at least for accommodation) during summer.  The good points: The location is good, and if you are lucky you can probably get a room with some nice lake view. The stuff is quite helpful and friendly and a very positive thing is that their english is quite good. Rooms are also spacious (compared to other options in Riva). The bad points: The hotel is quite old and needs renovation. While this is not necessarily bad, the problem is with the rooms that have no soundproof (we could clearly hear conversations from next room). There are no blinds in the rooms, meaning that you get up very early in the morning by the sun. We had…

title: Fantastic hotel, great position
review: Recently spent a week at this hotel, first week in July 2013 with Riviera Travel. A truly outstanding hotel with great food and I cannot speak highly enough of the staff who were so polite and helpful. Riva is a lovely place to stay and the position of this hotel on the lakeside makes it that much better.

title: Would go again
review: A brilliant stay. A relatively small hotel  with friendly staff made our week very enjoyable. A lovely old town to explore. The rear door of the hotel opens into the old area virtually next to the lake where the ferries dock. A North Lakes ticket cost 20.5 euro each with a slight reduction with proof of over 65yrs. With this ticket we visited Malcesine, Limone and return. There was a similar reduction at the nearby museum. There is a pleasant walk to nearby Torbole . Free Wifi in the hotel. Plenty of nearby bars and supermarkets.  Our decision to stay here was  influenced by the favourable reviews on tripadvisor, we were not disappointed and would definitely stay here again.  We were travelling with Riviera travel and the four excursions  were most interesting, especially the…

title: Location, location, location
review: Our first Riviera Travel holiday was a great success. The Europa is easily the best located of the many hotels in beautiful Riva. It is set right on the harbour and adjacent to the market square where there is always something happening. The hotel is surrounded by very good bars, restaurants and shops. We didn't have a lake view room and there was no noise inconvenience but I don't think that would have been a problem in any of the rooms. The bars etc. are very civilised and don't pound out loud music at any time.. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff in all areas were first class, particularly in the dining area. They could not have been more helpful and catered for all dietary requirements in a pleasant and efficient manner. Being vegetarian is sometimes a problem…

title: Lovely hotel in a prime position
review: Recently spent a week at this hotel, and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. Perfect location right on the lake edge and close to all restaurants, bars etc.Very friendly staff both on reception and in the dining room. Included breakfast and dinner were first class, with the evening meal very varied. Right next to the ferry stops so ideal if you want a trip to other towns around the lake (which we did). Asked for tea and coffee making facility and was provided with 2 cups and a kettle which had to be plugged in a socket in the bathroom. No tea or coffee provided, but quickly solved this at the local shop. Good aircon which could be regulated inside the room (other reviewers said otherwise). All in all a great little hotel. Paid extra for a lake view which we thought well…

title: Lovely hotel in a great position
review: Just returned from a week at this smashing hotel. Although it's a Best Western hotel it's more like a small family run hotel. The rooms are a little small but that's no problem. The aircon works a treat but you need to ask reception to turn it off at night if it's a bit too cold for you. The hotel itself is very clean and well looked after. And the location on the harbourside is exceptional.   The staff are very helpful and nothings too much trouble for them. My wife had some problems with the hair drier in our room but that was rectified within 5 minutes of reporting it.  We stayed on a half board basis and the breakfast buffet is good. However, the evening meals are even better. They are 4 courses with an antipasta buffet first course which is lovely. Its so good that if you…

title: Ford R     'Lovely friendly hotel'
review: Recently spent a week here with friends.Everything was excellent food, rooms, service and location. Very much hope to go back soon. Thoroughly enjoyed the 'gala night when there was music. The bar staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Ideal location
review: Recently returned from an eight day stay at the Europa. We stayed in room 309 which had a covered balcony in the roof section overlooking the harbour at Riva del Garda. We had views of the harbour, the clock tower and the mountains and lake. Room was of a reasonable standard with what I believe were memory foam mattresses and individual duvets on a double bed, which prevented any night time wrestling matches with the wife. Room was equipped with free safe (key obtained from reception on check-in with no deposit required), TV (with only one English channel-BBC World which wasn't a problem for us) and although we took our own travel kettle we were aware of other guests being provided with a kettle on request. Staff were very friendly and helpful. My request for extra coat hangers…

title: Fab hotel in a super location
review: Hubby and I have just returned from a weeks stay at this hotel. We booked this via Inghams holidays.  Its a lovely hotel and very clean. The room we had overlooked the lake and Riva town square which was well worth the extra cost. The staff throughout the hotel were friendly, knowledgable and very helpful. The food at both breakfast and evening meal was superb, well presented and plenty of choice and quantity. Would definately return to this hotel if we were to return to Riva. Can highly recommend. Hotel situated near the boats that transfer you across the lake. We hired a car for four days and the hotel has a very small (free) parking area at rear of hotel. The times we were unable to park here the hotel offered parking at 7 euro's a night in a secure carpark located very close…

title: Highly Recommended
review: We stayed at Hotel Europa in the 2nd week of May with Riviera Travel, From our experience the hotel can be highly recommended. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel and room was kept very clean and we found the food to be very good. The hotel is in great location, lovely views from all around and the town of Riva del Garda itself is very pleasant with most places within easy walking distance. The ferry is also close by for great trips on the lake.

title: Fab Little Hotel
review: We have just returned from a week in Riva del Garda with Riviera Holidays. We particularly choice this hotel because of it's location and previous good reviews. We were not disappointed on either count. The hotel is beautifully situated in the town square and having taken the advice of previous reviewers we paid extra for a lake view. It is stunning to look over the lake especially as the sun rises up over the mountains in the morning. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful and as this is a small hotel you felt as though they treated you as individuals. The food was plentiful and as well as an extensive buffet breakfast unexpectedly they also had boiled and scrambled eggs and bacon available every morning. For your evening meal you had a choice of three starters…

title: Good Hotel, Great Location
review: This lovely hotel is situated right in the quiet harbour of Riva, surrounded by small and hospitable street bars, and small soveniour shops on the quayside. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, and were very pleased with all aspects of the service and accomodation provided. In particular the food (we were on half board) was wonderful, and varied. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful, and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. We were located in a room at the top of the building (4th floor) at the side of the hotel facing north, with views towards the mountains. These top rooms seem to have only recently been created under the room, and as such were in brand new condition. Overall, a very good hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it.

title: Beautiful, friendly hotel
review: My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights in April 2013 as part of a package from Riviera travel in the UK. The hotel rooms are quite small but that is a small price to pay for the location on the quay side of Lake Garda. The food was plentiful and always beautifully cooked with a different menu choice every night. The breakfast buffet was taken in the conservatory room overlooking the lake and quayside and always had a good selection of foods to suit all appetites. Tea and coffee making facilities are available, but you have to ask for them at reception. All the staff there were extremely friendly and helpful and all spoke English well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and will go back in the future.

title: Great location, nice hotel, lovely people
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our five-night stay at Hotel Europa.  Everything was sparkling clean and bright, and the staff was warm and welcoming.    The hotel restaurant was very good, with a wide selection of tasty foods at the breakfast buffet.  We especially enjoyed having breakfast on the sunny terrace, overlooking the piazza and the lake.    Although our room was small, our "double" bed was two singles pushed together, and there was only one wall outlet for recharging our electronic devices, none of those things mattered to us at all.  The bathroom was spacious, and we were thoroughly comfortable in our accommodations.  In fact, we slept like babies. Our window opened onto the piazza, with a breathtaking view of the lake and the distant mountains.  We'd definitely recommend…

title: Super hotel
review: We came with Riviera Tours on the first week of their season. We chose this hotel because of its position, being close (overlooking) the lake and near to shops,cafes, bars etc. we have been de lighted by everything here. The Staff have been helpful when needed, and the hotel rooms are well supplied with all you would expect of a good 3 star standard. Our holiday has been on a bed, breakfast and evening meal basis and the food has been perfectly acceptable with sufficient choice for us. We would stay here again and recommend it to others.

title: Wonderful location, food and staff
review: Stayed here in September with Riviera travel. The location is brilliant, we had booked a room with a lake view but it didn't have a balcony, I think that there are only 2 with balcony. The ferries are right outside across the square, the buses for the west side of the lake stop quite near the hotel, but the buses for the east side of the lake are from the bus station, a good 15 minute walk away, but you're on hols, so what?  Food far exceeded our expectations, with a huge spread for the antipasta and a daily choice from a changing menu for mains. The food could not be faulted and I would recommend anybody to go for the half board option. Breakfasts were very good  The staff were all very helpful and helped to make our stay in Riva very enjoyable

title: Holiday in Riva Lake Garda
review: Lovely small hotel in Riva Del Garda, Italy.  Rooms are quite small but comfortable.  When we arrived the room we were given was a bit dark and gloomy but as soon as we mentioned the fact to the manager he instantly found us another room without any hesitation.  We stayed half  board and the food was exellent with waiter service.  I was unwell for a couple of days and the staff were most concerned and did every thing possible to help my condition.  The hotel was spotless.  It has a lakeside view and close to shops and bars.  We would certainly stay there again.

title: A nice hotel with a wonderful location
review: We particulary enjoyed eating in the dining-hall with a splendid view of the harbour and the lake. The evening meals were excellent, and the staff were always friendly and helpful (particularly the ladies in charge of reception). A highly recommendable place!

title: A wonderful hotel
review: Just returned from Hotel Europa in Riva del Garda where we stayed for seven nights. The hotel certainly deserves its four star rating.  The interior of the hotel is superb and the food extremely good.  The bedroom was spacious as was the bathroom with all needs provided and if you had forgotten to pack any toiletries they were available at reception. The staff were very professional and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend the Europa to anyone.

title: Comfort andTranquility
review: The Best Western Hotel Europa is a place to which we return when we have an overwhelming need to "chill out". We found the Europa by good fortune over fifteen years ago and have just enjoyed our fourth visit and you don't go back to a place that isn't good. There have, of course, been changes but the overall atmosphere and ambience remains the same. The rooms are OK, clean and comfortable; some are better than others so read the reviews for hints on that. The public rooms are comfortable and casual. We have always found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The food is exceptional for this grade of hotel, we've never had a poor meal here and you're never rushed. Finally the location has to be one of the finest in town with the mountain behind and the lake in front; convenient…

title: Have booked again for next year !
review: Stayed for six nights late August. Must have one of the best locations and view over the lake across to the Monte Baldo mountains especially from the restaurant with its full-length sliding windows. The staff were very professional ,helpful and friendly. The food was good with plenty of choice for dinner and especially for breakfast. The new owners have plans for further refurbishment and the Manager Marion ensures the smooth running of this Best Western Hotel. We travelled independently and my wife and I have already booked for next year ! Leslie Marsden

title: Delightful Hotel
review: Stayed in the Europa 9-16th July 2012 as part of a holiday with Riviera Travel. An hour drive from Verona and at the head of Lake Garda.  After reading previous reviews concerning potential noise from the outside bars and eateries, we decided to request a courtyard room. Room 112 was a good size and very clean, with a side view over the lake. We also had a terrace with table and chairs. Apparently the front (lake facing) rooms were not too noisy either and those that stayed in these just shut the double glazed windows.   The hotel is a few metres from the waterfront and only a couple of minutes walk from the town square and shops.   The highlight of the hotel itself was the food. The chef received a standing ovation at the end of the week. You are allocated a table for the week…

title: Superb Location
review: Superb Location with easy access to transport , bars and night entertainment combined with a clean room and good food.  Staff were friendly and helpful but , given that this was part of Austria until 1927 , in a more Germanic style than one might find further south.  Not so sure about maintenance levels as our patio tiles contained no grouting , we were missing a bath plug and some bathroom electrics needed attention. The lifts were not always functioning as expected and it's never good to see Graffitti in a lift !  Overall a pleasant stay and although the paragraph above might sound awful these are simple things that an efficient Hotelier  can deal with.

title: Very good place
review: I stayed 4 days in this hotel and I was very impressed about the placement and cleanness of the entire hotel and room. Is well placed in the old city of Riva del Garda having an amazing view of the lake. I recommend this hotel. The only minus that I have found is that the room are small and can be an inconvenient.

title: Good hotel - GREAT food
review: Stayed a week in June 2012. Average room size, clean & tidy overlooking lake and bars. Some reviews say noisey but we just shut the double glazed windows and turned on the air con - couldnt even hear the town clock that chimed every quarter until late evening. Small swim pool & sun bathing area on roof a bonus. Rooms with lake view AND balcony are superior to those with just lake view. If you get the option do take half board accommodation because the food is fabulous. Great location, great hotel for a great holiday.

title: Everything on your doorstep, plus a good hotel
review: Breakfast is upgrade continental.  Evening meal was pretty good, service good and very accommodating if nothing on menu appealed.  Good beds, wonderful bathrooms. Staff are efficient and helpful.  Now, about the lifts, these take a bit of mastering (such fun)but adds to the ambience.Hotel is adjacent to ferry (this stops around 7pm), all the good bars are also adjacent in the square, you can watch world go by. By the way, there are no balconies at this hotel.  Excellent place for the over 50's.  A good bar which also does excellent snacks and some meals, is Cambusa, right in square, next to Hotel Centrale (but no connection to).  You wont get a better service than here if you want to just take your time with a  drink of whatever,  have a snack or something a bit more…

title: Good Hotel in Great Location
review: Stayed in the Hotel for a week in May 2012 as part of a Riviera Touring Holiday. The room was good sized and very clean. It had the benefit of air conditioning and the even greater benefit of being able to open the windows wide open for fresh air. The room window overlooked a courtyard but there was some road noise with windows open so choice to made there at night. Situated in the older part of town right next to the lake with mountain views with several layback cafe/bars on your doorstep, it is hard to think of much better location.  Food at the hotel for breakfast and dinner was fine. The only negative was a rather sullen maitre d who I assumed didn't like coach trips but his staff were brilliant which made up for him. The remainder of hotel staff were fine too. If you are…

title: Holiday of a lifetime
review: On a recent trip to Lake Garda, Italy My wife and I stopped at the Best Western Europa hotel in Riva. The hotel is immediately adjacent to the lake ( 50 meters away ). The views from a lakeside room are fabulous looking down on the town square, the lake and the mountains in the background. The standard of food ( we stayed half board ) was excellent. A superb selection of both hot and cold dishes for breakfast together with a selectable four course evening meal served byan efficient and humorous staff increased our waistline significantly over the week ! The rooms were of a suitable size with an excellent power shower and a full length bath. The staff on reception were exceptionally helpful. Although the rooftop pool was only just opening due to being early in the season, the…

title: Excellent position and food
review: Have just returned from 7 days in this lakeside hotel. We did not have a balcony but did have a lake view room - lovely view - but this side of the hotel can be noisy at night from the bars below. We just closed the window when it became too loud. The room was small and there was an absence of hotel information but the terrace restaurant enjoys a magnificent view of the harbour. The evening meals were excellent.

title: Clean, friendly hotel in a great location.
review: Just spent 8 enjoyable nights at this newly renovated hotel. I found a welcoming staff, an extremely clean room with a new bathroom and a comfy bed. The only annoyance was the lack of reliable internet access.

title: Wish we could go again
review: Right in the centre by the lake. Luckily we had a room at the back so didn't have the noise from the front. Lots of bars and cafes at the front, great to be at, but when it is bedtime, nice to be quiet. We had a nice little courtyard we overlooked. Beautiful roof terrace with small pool and lots of chairs to lounge on overlooking the lake and mountains. Food good as well and staff were all friendly and helpful

title: A touch of US Best Western in Europe
review: This hotel provide a touch of an US based hotel in Italy.  It is a large facility.  Well kept, with relatively large rooms.  The location is good.  The parking garage is in a different building across the main road.  It is a 3 - 5 minutes walk to the garage.  It is located just in the center of the old city.  Near many restaurants and shops.  A great location for day trips in the vicinity.  The breakfast is served in a very nice balcony overlooking the lake.  It is a good best western breakfast.

title: Great view and location
review: Our friends made the reservation and we were surprised to find our hotel on the main square. At first I was disappointed not to have a room overlooking that view, but we were quite tired, and our quiet room on a courtyard was just the thing. As it turned out, there was a DJ at the restaurant next door on the square who was playing awful 70's disco music that evening and we were glad we didn't have to listen to it.   The room was quite satisfactory, although the towels were small and thin. Otherwise, the bed comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and the staff were all friendly and attentive. We ate in the restaurant in the evening, overlooking the beautifully lighted piazza. Food was very good, and the atmosphere was great.

title: October in Riva ...
review: The hotel is perfectly situated , I managed to park in the internal parking and the staff was extremely polite and helpful....  My room was very small with a nice bathroom . Unfortunately I had no view over the magnificent scenery . Wonderful breakfast in an amazing terrace overlooking the lake. Would love to go back ....

title: Wonderful.
review: I am amazed at the amount of bad reviews this lovely hotel has had on this site. People saying you are watched at breakfast and you shouldn't stay there if you're English! None of this is true at all. No one watched my boyfriend and I when we had breakfast, and all the staff were friendly and polite.  We stayed for a week recently, and found it to be a very nice place indeed. Our room overlooked the road, but that didn't bother us as we had a balcony, and could also see the mountains and lake. The room was spacious, clean and tidy and welcoming, and the bathroom was great too, with a wonderfuly powerful shower in it.  The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts were delicious. I would recommend the hotel as well for its location, as it backs onto a lovely area…

title: Superb location for a hotel chain...
review: After planning various stops throughout Slovenia and Italy, we were concerned that Best Western may be the weak link as we prefer the smaller, more intimate guest houses. However, we were pleasantly surprised with our room which was fairly large. It was obvious the hotel had been 'modernised' so it had a similar feel to a travelodge. The bathroom was slightly retro but perfectly clean.  The best bit.... what a spectacular view! We were very lucky to have one of the front facing rooms - no balcony, but you could open the doors wide to experience the vibrant atmosphere outside. Live entertainment took place but it didn't go on too late and we actually had a fantastic night's sleep as unlike most other places we had stayed in, there was constant air conditioning.

title: Perfect location and good value
review: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. We had a room overlooking the harbor/lake with a small balcony, which was very pleasant.  The room was simple but clean and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and breakfast quite abundant.  We also had a very nice dinner in their lovely restaurant with views of the lake. Perfect location to explore the old part of town and watch people walking. Easy parking in private lot behind the hotel. Bikes for rent, and free wi-fi.

title: Fabulous location, thin walls!
review: The hotel is in a perfect location, right in the main square at Riva overlooking the harbour, rooms are an excellent size, immaculately clean and well furnished.  The hotel 'pool' is more of an adult paddling pool but is located on a nice roof terrace which overlooks Riva. Walls are extremely thin, you can hear the conversations from adjoining rooms, Buffet style breakfast is served until 1030 but the staff do not replenish the food so if you arrive after 9.30 your choice is extremely limited. That being said nothing can detract away from the fantastic location,room size, cleanliness and friendly staff, we would definitely stay here again for those points alone.

title: Nice hotel which I would highly recommend.
review: I stayed here in June 2011 with my girlfriend and I think this hotel was almost perfect. The location is ideal as it is situated right beside the lake and less than a one minute walk from the streets where all the shops and restaurants are contained.  The rooms are small but they are very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant looks out onto the lake and is really nice although we only ate there for breakfast. Breakfast is a continental style buffet with all the usuals such as croissants, breads, cereals, cakes, tea/coffee, juices.  The swimming pool is located on the roof and is actually tiny. It's more like a big bath. There are about 15-20 deck chairs for sunbathing.   My only real gripe was that there is no gym in the hotel. To be…

title: location and balcony
review: Our room and bathroom were big enough for a short stay,  clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. There's free parking but the small parking ground right at the hotel is probably most of the time occupied. There's a car park very close by but it's 12 Euros/day :-(  Breakfast is good with many choices. You can have breakfast on the paned patio overviewing the harbour - lovely! There's a small swimming pool on the roof terrace which we didn't use though.  Best thing about our stay at the hotel was the cute little balcony overviewing the harbour! We could sit there in the evenings and watch the (moderate) 'hustle and bustle' around the harbour. There are Cafes, Restaurants directly at the hotel so if you're looking for absolute peace and quiet it's probably not the right choice. But,…

title: Perfect place for holiday
review: In late May 2011 we stayed at the Hotel Europa on Lake Garda as part of a Riviera Travel booking. On arrival we found the staff most courteous and helpful which continued throughout our week’s stay. Our room was located overlooking the lake, harbour and piazza and we found the extra cost (for the view) well worth it. Our room was comfortable and a good standard, plenty of wardrobe space and a safe inside, which cost 1 euro per day if you wanted to make use of it (there’s a 10 euro deposit per week). The bathroom had a bathtub as well as shower (over the bath) and was kept spotless each day by the cleaning staff. Everything worked well and there were the usual complimentary toiletries provided.  Breakfast was informal where guests could choose where to sit and weren’t restricted…

title: The Perfect Place to Stay
review: We stayed here for our 30th Wedding Anniversary we booked through Riviera Travel.The Hotel was Lovely and clean throughout, room was adequate, with a good shower, and well lit bathroom, good wardrobe for hanging all your clothes in. We were overlooking the rooftop swimming pool, and the mountains. You can overlook the Lake but for an extra charge.The only downside was the Tv stations we would have liked to have watched a bit of tv after we had been out for our evening meal. There was only a news station, sport station, and we would have liked to have watched a general station. films etc. The staff were very helpfull, and the Lady owner of the hotel was very kind. breakfast although not a cooked, was more than adequate. The dining room was also onto a conservatory overlooking the…

title: Excellent value in excellent location on an very beautiful lake
review: Nothing inspiring or even that noticeable as an entrance between shops opening up to hotel above but great location on front right by the ferries with restuarants just outside. Has free car park just behind off main road.

title: Excellent service and perfect location
review: We, three persons and a dog, arrived July 14 and the temperature was 38 degrees celsius. The day before our arrival we had sent a mail to the reception asking them for a room with a balcony since the dog had a tuff time in the heat. The receptionists (all of them) were the kindest and most serviceminded you could wish for - they had arranged for us a room with a balcony facing the lake/harbour!!! I think the room number was 110. What a relief and joy when we went into the room. That ment our dog could sleep outside, at the balcony. And it also ment we had a wonderful time in the evenings, sipping on a cold white wine and looking at the view. The room itself was clean and was big enough for the 3 of us. I also must mention the breakfast!!! It was a luxury to have your breakfast…

title: Perfect Location
review: Located on the harbour front the Europa is an ideal place to base a stay on Lake Garda. Malcesine was the preferred location but lack of available rooms meant Riva was the next best option. It turn out to be the right decision - Malcesine is beautiful but with a vehicle Riva was the right place to stay. Rooms are functional but not where you would want to (nor should) spend your time in such a beautiful location. Pool area on the roof is a good areas to view the comings and goings in the harbour but you really shouldn't go to Riva to sunbathe. Get out on the Lake, sit in a bar and watch the world go by, walk through the narrow streets of Malcesine and sit in a restaurant and watch the world go by some more.  The Europa is a perfectly acceptable hotel to stay in - it benefits…

title: Pleasant well located hotel
review: We spent a very pleasant week in the Europa on B&B basis. The rooms were tidy,comfortable and clean if a little cramped , especially the bath room. The rooms are quite basic with no tea/coffee maker or fridge. Some of us paid over £100 extra for a lake view . The view was of the harbour (not the lake) and was through a small window (no balcony). This option is not worth the high price. The breakfast was quite good with a reasonable chioce. The main disappointment was the lack of healthy bread and fresh (rather than tinned) fruit. One evening we suffered from very loud music from the basement bar. Be warned. There are plenty of plus points too. The Europa is in the middle of town close to the ferries and plenty of excellent resturants such as the Nationale and Leon D'oro. Also…

title: Highly recommended for location
review: This hotel was well located in front of the ferry jetty at the north end of Lake Garda. We found our std twin bed room just adequate in size, comfortable beds, well equipped bath/shower room and good air cond. The buffet breakfast was good and held in the terrace, overlooking the harbour. Our main complaint was that the air cond was switched off without our permission altho we could open the room window.  Upon our request, the air cond was switched on again. There is one free internet pc/connection in the lounge area. There are many local restaurants nearby. The best were D'oro and at Hotel Sole but fairly expensive. The only Chinese restaurant in Riva was cheap; good portions but about average in taste.  Beware of the Cafe de Paris - cheap, taste ok but....

title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review: This is our return visit from 8 years ago.  The location is this hotel is practically right across from the docks to catch the ferry to other towns on Lake Garda.  The breakfast is superb.  We had a great time and will return again.

title: PLEASE GO BACK TO HALF BOARD
review: I have visited Riva for 25 years, usually stay and a certain hotel but thought I'd like a change so booked Europa for myself and friend (she'd never been to Italy before)  We were so impressed by the meals, the courtesey, the room and we decided we'd book again for 2008.  Such was our luck, Europa stopped half board and only do B & B.  It's in a prime position too.  However, in 2008,   having had a not so good stay the hotel I've  used for  years, I intend to go back for B & B at Europa, and eat out at night.    A point my friend and I found the lift system  rather amusing (but then we're English)

title: A very good 3 star hotel
review: This 3 star B & B hotel is in an excellent position overlooking the harbour.  Our room was spotless, not the most spacious but perfectly adequate. Twin beds, desk, table and loads of drawers and wardrobe space. No view. Overlooked a small courtyard but suited us as the room was very quiet. The breakfast room overlooks the Lake. Good variety for continental breakfast, ham cheese, fruit, gorgeous bread and rolls etc. All the Staff were helpful and pleasant. Liked best : Approx 50 yards to get a boat across the Lake. Eating places practically next door. Liked least: No mirror above desk. No tea/coffee facility in room.

title: Great location and very helpful staff.
review: Top location by the ferry terminal and very close to the town centre although rather noisy in the evening until about midnight due to proximity of bars and restaurants (but beautifully silent in the morning!).  Staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant.  We got everything we asked for.  We requested and were given rooms with lake view (Euro 20 supplement).  Breakfast terrace has wonderful view and the breakfast buffet is good and very generous.  Rooms are rather small and characterless but clean and modern.  Only 12 car park spaces, although this is better than most of the hotels in the town centre that have none at all.  Arrive late in the evening and they will direct you to an underground public car park (spotless, well lit and secure) on the edge of the town and a 10…

title: Great location
review: Just returned from a lovely holiday in Riva del Garda having stayed at the Europa Hotel for a week (wished it could have been longer).  The hotel breakfast room was a big surprise on our first morning as the view across the lake was spectacular and the selection of food was extremely generous.  Our room was rather small and did not overlook the lake but it was adequate and had plenty of storage space, a good size bathroom and very clean.  The roof terrace and pool was an added bonus, very quiet and a good place to read when not taking in the lake view.  We could not have planned a better location.  It was convenient for the lake steamers, the restaurants, the old town and shops.  It was just great to step out into what seemed like a postcard picture every morning.

title: OK hotel, shame about the door
review: Riva is lovely and we booked for early May to ensure it wouldn't be too hot, and the weather was perfect.  We had paid extra for a room overlooking the lake - however, the night we arrived we noticed that out room door didn't lock.  This was reported to Paulo the night manager immediately.  He was very laid back about the whole thing, assuring us that our possessions would be safe,  and promised to have it dealt with, but the day we left it STILL hadn't been seen to.  So if you are allocated Room 207, check to see if it's been sorted yet! Another reason we had booked the Europa was for the swimming pool on the roof but when we enquired about it, it wasn't going to be opened "until next week".  I wonder how many guests over the weeks had been told "next week". Apart from that,…

title: Trying to change the rate at check out
review: What a shame. Perfectly OK stay for three days and then, at check out, the front desk guy tries to increase the room rates despite the hotel's reservation confirmation clearly stating the rate quoted by them when the reservation was made a couple of months before...There had been a "mistake". What a terrible tactic for a hotel management to try. He persists, stating that it is in case we come back to stay again. He doesn't realise that trying to hike the price when the bill is being settled is a sure guarantee against ever wanting to stay there again. Terrible attitude to customer service.

title: great location
review: We visited the best western europa in september of this year.First impressions were that it was ideally located on the side of the river, with an excellant view across the town square. We had paid extra for a room with a lakeside view and although the rooms were very simply decorated (not at all as shown on the website) the view was gorgeous. The downside to our front facing room was the noise late at night from the bars and early in the morning from the shops and restaurants setting up. Food in the hotel comprised of a continental breakfast, well stocked with cereal, freshfruit, cheeses and meats and a four course evening meal with an excellant and interesting selection of meats, pastas and desserts. Being vegetarian i initially found nothing i could eat on the menu, one word…

title: Nothing special...
review: Past reviewers of this hotel have given a strangely flattering but inaccurate picture of this mediocre establishment. My wife and I have just spent an enjoyable week here but would not consider it up to the standards of many other hotels in the area in this tariff range. Yes, it has a lakeside position…but not a ‘great’one. Its lakeside entrance door is situated next to a rather tacky little bar, which can get quite noisy in the evenings. Unless you are using the ferries daily I see no pleasure in being situated adjacent to the main ferry terminal with all the activity around the booking booths and coach drop-offs.  To compare it to a ‘four-star’ is stretching the imagination a little too far. It is just one of those typical bland, terraced establishments which have been tarted…

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Super holiday. Food excellent and lovely ambience in hotel restaurant overlooking the lake. We had a spacious and immaculate room with a mountain view. Great, central location, just step out of the hotel and you are in the hub of things. We would return.

title: A nice friendly hotel in a beautiful location.
review: Lake Garda in August is beautiful and very busy. It was a  struggle to find a reasonably priced hotel close to the centre of Riva del Garda but the Best Western Europa fit the bill.  We arrived very late on a Sunday night and our first experience was of the friendly night porter moving his own car to give us a parking space right in front of the door. This set the tone of the hotel very well.  The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was a little small but clean and well designed with enough space for everything. It would have been nice to get a view overlooking the lake but it didn't really matter.  I would have no hesitation recommending it to anyone.

title: The Best for everything
review: Over the years I've stayed at many hotels in Riva area, all of them good but the Europa is the very best.  Very clean, rooms excellent, staff very helpful and the food very, very good (need a 2 mile walk after dinner!) The lift arrangement gives the brain cells an airing but that's all part of the fun.  This hotel is a 3 star and should be rated a 4 star plus.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Had a wonderful time at this lovely hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable with excellent facilities.  The food very enjoyable and plentiful.  The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. We managed to get a lake facing room and were not charged extra for it.  I would definitely have gone back again but understand that next year they will only be doing bed and breakfast .  This is a great pity as the whole dining experience was very enjoyable.  We were allocated a table for the whole of the stay and managed to get to know several guests.  I feel that I would miss this if I had to find a different place to eat each night.  If this is true I will reluctantly have to find another hotel.  Excellent location and views.  All in all we had a superb holiday and feel very…

title: Great hotel, great position in town
review: This wasn't our first choice but they were already full however, as things turned out I was delighted we ended up here - it was a great hotel - right beside the lake in the main old town square.  The room was modern, simple and very clean with a good bathroom and excellent aircon.  Our room overlooked the lake and I was worried we may suffer from a lot of noise from the bars/restaurants below but the triple/quadruple? glazing on the windows meant we didn't hear a thing.  Breakfast was buffet and standard European and all the staff were very pleasant.    There is a small car park if you you take a cheap Ryanair flight and drive (the return Ryanair flight from Bergamo was another story and I would never ever ever travel through Liverpool airport again - but thats another story).

title: Magnificent
review: This was our 5th visit to Riva del Garda and our 2nd stay at the Europa. It is the best hotel we have stayed at in Riva with excellent and clean accommodation, excellent regional food on the menu and really friendly and professional staff. We have recommended this hotel to our friends and would ask others to give it a try

title: good location
review: The location of the hotel is very convenient, with free parking.  The rooms are on the small side. It would have been nice to look out on the waterfront. It was clean and quiet.  Very good breakfast.

title: Brilliant Location
review: Perfect location, alongside ferry quay and square with cafes. Quiet, with other resorts easily reached by bus or ferry.First class restaurant with a wonderful panoramic view, excellent service, good food especially 5 course gala night on Sunday eve. Our 2nd floor room was very spacious, spotlessly clean, air-conditioned and accessed by 2 pristine lifts, plus another lift down to front of hotel. Ideal for wheelchair users. Roof-top sunbathing area and pool clean, small but adequate, with shower and toilet. Highly recommended all round.

title: not great, just ok
review: Ok, very well positioned with a nice view,if you get a room with a view. In fact, I was in a single room with just the basic and no lake view, but my parentswere in a nice and larger room with a beautiful lake view. The breakfast is at this huge balcony with a great view of the lake, protected from the wind and the rain. Breakfast is just ok, nothing else. Coffee did seem to have been heated several times, tasted like old. This hotel has a serious parking problem. It´s free,  but there is no place for all the guests and it´s hard to park on the street. In general, this hotel is not great but it´s ok.

title: Wonderful place!
review: This hotel is extremely well located with a secure car park and very comfortable accommodation.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the food is very good, with an excellent table d'hote fixed price dinner menu and good buffet breakfast.  The restaurant is partly in a covered (and enclosed for cooler days) balcony area overlooking the main, pretty piazza of Riva del Garda.  From reception there are internal steps (or lift) to a door leading directly onto the piazza which surrounds the pretty harbour from where the lake ferries go to Malcesine, Limone etc.  There are plenty of restaurants within a short walk (2 - 10 minutes) to choose from and, for a special meal, can particularly recommend l'Osteria de l'Anzolim tucked into a corner of the square behind the harbourside…

title: Stunning Views, charmless staff
review: The Hotel Europa scores on three counts — location, location and location. Set opposite the town harbour it enjoys spectacular views across the café lined piazza and clock tower, out towards the sparkling lake and mountains beyond. If, like us, you are lucky enough to get one of the few front rooms with a balcony, this is wonderful. You can throw open the French windows and drink in the atmosphere. However I suspect life isn’t so rosy if you are assigned one of the back rooms. A fellow guest told us that she had a view of a brick wall.   The hotel itself is pleasant enough in a bland 80s sort of way, though nowhere near as elegant and luxurious as its brochure would suggest. There’s a spacious lounge, a rooftop sundeck with a small plunge pool and steam room (the latter carrying…

title: Excellent location
review: Location was brilliant- views from rooms were great.It was really interesting to people watch etc. Staff were mostly really friendly and helpful- particularly in the restaurant but one of the receptionist wasn't helpful (the other was great). The food was great- breakfast and evening meal- and the conservatory dining room was really attractive, Hotel was clean and well organised. Room service was a little haphazard. Even when it said room service when you asked for it they said they couldn't do it as not enough people on duty!! Swimming pool was very small.

title: Not a 4 star
review: Spent a week at Riva Del Garda srayed at Best western Europa was not impressed with the Hotel or the staff very basic,would go to Lake Garda again but not the Europa Hotel

title: No more than average
review: Spend a long weekend end of march. Rooms very italian, basic style and not too welcoming. Breakfast just average with neither great chocie nor quality. Staff reasonably friendly. Not many parking spaces available. On the plus side: great location, lovely terrace with lake view for breakfast and nice harbourside front. Not a real dael at € 95.

title: Simply Magic
review: Have just returned from a superb week at the Europa Hotel - a 3 star plus right on the harbour. The hotel is superb bar none and has a view to die for! You are right in the centre of Riva, and the terrace restaurant has views across Riva over a 5 star meal!! The restaurant is superb - we had 7 gourmet Italian meals, the staff were so professional, and the whole feel was more 5 star than 3! The double glazing in the hotel made sure that even with a lake view room once we closed the window we heard nothing ----- amazing. It really is a beautiful hotel, and even people at the 4 star Sole had been looking at it. It is part if the Best Western chain, the owner lives in the hotel .... we could go on and on and on ..... we have been to Riva many times and can not recommend anything…
